descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the
European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of
DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850
Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2,
Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity
and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Your missions

As a visitor on ManoMano website, you might have a question about a
product, need help looking for the right tool or even need guidance in your DIY project. The “Expert Advice” feature
team's mission is to build the solutions to offer help from DIY experts to our visitors in order to increase sales and
customer satisfaction.

Advice is one of ManoMano key differentiators and an important contributor to our business. By
joining this feature team you will have a unique opportunity to work on innovative large scale projects with a strong
business impact.

Your challenge as the Engineering Lead of the Expert Advice will be to:
- Work in close
collaboration with product / engineering managers and architects
- Take responsibilities for the quality (performance,
availability, scalability, maintainability, velocity) of the deliveryManage the developers of the feature team
- Embody
the ManoMano values: bold, ingenuity, care

Context

- 39 feature teams in January 2022
- Agile mindset since the
birth of ManoMano: Scrum, SAFe, A/B testing are widely applied
- 3 offices (Paris, Bordeaux and Barcelona) with up to
100% remote
- Our working language is English. We are using French as well and some of us speak Spanish, German,
Italian…

Main activities

-You will join a team, currently composed of 4 developers and a product manager, in order
to provide our visitors with the best possible advice, with the support of other teams (Product, UX/UI, SRE, Agile, QA,
Platform engineering, Legal, Payment, HR…).

Responsibilities of the team include:

- Design, build and run new
featuresMaintain and decommission legacy applications
- Assimilate business context and company expectations
- Learn &
teach through mentoring, pair programming, code reviews, knowledge transfer
- Continuously improve the quality of
processes and technical components
- Deploy code up to production and proactively monitor it
- Contribute to the
ManoMano shared assets (libraries, tools, etc.)

Technical stack

- Web applications in TypeScript, React, Next.js,
Redux-Saga, React Admin
- Microservices in Spring Boot and Java 11 (soon 17)
- Architecture inspired by the Hexagonal
and Clean Architecture
- PostgreSQL, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Kafka, RedisAWS, Docker, Kubernetes, HelmKong, KeycloakGitlab
CI/CD
- GTM, Amplitude, Datadog, Sentry, Slack, Jira

We do have 2 legacy applications written in PHP that we are
phasing out.

There are also opportunities within the company to later work on projects built with Kotlin, Go, Python
or PHP.

Requirements

- 5+ years of experience as a software engineer
- Management or at least tech-leading
experience (management training is provided)
- Agile, DevOps and product minded
- Data driven in decision making
-
Team spirit, willing to help wherever it is needed (monitoring, leading agile rituals, decommissioning legacy code,
writing documentation, mentoring teammates…)
- Be lazy, automate things in order to helps us be more scalable and
efficient
- Fluent in english
- Able to work in a fast changing (and not perfect) environment
- Taste for continuous
improvement, with a strong desire to test, experiment and share better solutions
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Your missions

As a visitor on ManoMano website, you might have a question about a product, need help looking for the right tool or even need guidance in your DIY project. The “Expert Advice” feature team's mission is to build the solutions to offer help from DIY experts to our visitors in order to increase sales and customer satisfaction.

Advice is one of ManoMano key differentiators and an important contributor to our business. By joining this feature team you will have a unique opportunity to work on innovative large scale projects with a strong business impact.

Your challenge as the Engineering Lead of the Expert Advice will be to:
- Work in close collaboration with product / engineering managers and architects
- Take responsibilities for the quality (performance, availability, scalability, maintainability, velocity) of the deliveryManage the developers of the feature team
- Embody the ManoMano values: bold, ingenuity, care

Context

- 39 feature teams in January 2022
- Agile mindset since the birth of ManoMano: Scrum, SAFe, A/B testing are widely applied
- 3 offices (Paris, Bordeaux and Barcelona) with up to 100% remote
- Our working language is English. We are using French as well and some of us speak Spanish, German, Italian…

Main activities

-You will join a team, currently composed of 4 developers and a product manager, in order to provide our visitors with the best possible advice, with the support of other teams (Product, UX/UI, SRE, Agile, QA, Platform engineering, Legal, Payment, HR…).

Responsibilities of the team include:

- Design, build and run new featuresMaintain and decommission legacy applications
- Assimilate business context and company expectations
- Learn & teach through mentoring, pair programming, code reviews, knowledge transfer
- Continuously improve the quality of processes and technical components
- Deploy code up to production and proactively monitor it
- Contribute to the ManoMano shared assets (libraries, tools, etc.)

Technical stack

- Web applications in TypeScript, React, Next.js, Redux-Saga, React Admin
- Microservices in Spring Boot and Java 11 (soon 17)
- Architecture inspired by the Hexagonal and Clean Architecture
- PostgreSQL, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Kafka, RedisAWS, Docker, Kubernetes, HelmKong, KeycloakGitlab CI/CD
- GTM, Amplitude, Datadog, Sentry, Slack, Jira

We do have 2 legacy applications written in PHP that we are phasing out.

There are also opportunities within the company to later work on projects built with Kotlin, Go, Python or PHP.

Requirements

- 5+ years of experience as a software engineer
- Management or at least tech-leading experience (management training is provided)
- Agile, DevOps and product minded
- Data driven in decision making
- Team spirit, willing to help wherever it is needed (monitoring, leading agile rituals, decommissioning legacy code, writing documentation, mentoring teammates…)
- Be lazy, automate things in order to helps us be more scalable and efficient
- Fluent in english
- Able to work in a fast changing (and not perfect) environment
- Taste for continuous improvement, with a strong desire to test, experiment and share better solutions

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Background & Missions

ManoMano, already positioned as European leader in DIY,
wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. For this, ManoMano is growing fast and is looking for an
Engineering Manager in Bordeaux to support multiple teams on the Buyers tribe. 

These teams are in charge of one of
the core services of the marketplace : they are operating and improving the systems processing more than 150000 orders a
day at a fast growing pace.

Responsibilities

You will be in charge of a tribe, composed of 4 teams, in order to
create, in collaboration with the product and UX / UI teams, an amazing experience for the merchants and the
customer.

Your mission is to manage complex technology projects, ensure the growth and achievement of your team's
goals and drive improvements on your teams’ perimeters.
It is expected that you act as a mentor to help your teams grow
and deliver high quality products and services.

You will ensure that projects are on track and work closely with
ManoMano developers and technical teams to make the things happen !
Work closely with product teams to build the best
products for our customers and merchants.
You will be responsible for the planning, execution and success of complex
technological projects: it also has the function of anticipating blockers and being the one who will make life easier
for the teams !

Be the guarantor of the ManoMano Tech culture, make it live and make sure your teams are happy to
come every morning.

You will collaborate with ManoMano Talent Team to recruit the best developers to complete your
teams

lists.content:
• Review and challenge current Finance tooling architecture and interdependencies with non Finance tools
  • Define Finance tooling automation roadmap and action plan
  • Identify opportunities to optimize tooling architecture, select best in class /most relevant market solutions and run tenders
  • Lead, coordinate, implement and run automation projects with internal and external stakeholders
  • Be responsible for maintaining an always up to date and scalable Finance tooling environment

• You have a higher education Bac + 5 (business school, engineering school or a university with a specialization in Finance / Management)
  • You have confirmed experience at least 5 years acquired within a accounting, FP&A, and/or digital Finance transformation department
  • You have significant experience of carrying IT projects in an agile framework
  • Passionate about Finance IS and innovative Finance tooling solutions
  • Strong knowledge of project management 
  • Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal in French and English
  • Strategic, curious and doer mindset

The FP&A team is responsible for managing the company’s financial forecasting and
reporting processes as well as partnering with business stakeholders to enable and drive financially informed
decision-making. As an Analyst in the FP&A Business partner team and reporting to the FP&A Business partner lead, you
will have the exciting opportunity to grow and develop as a finance professional. You will be in charge of providing
financial support and expertise to the fast-growing Operations and Marketing teams.

The FP&A team is responsible for managing the company’s financial forecasting and reporting processes as well as partnering with business stakeholders to enable and drive financially informed decision-making. As an Analyst in the FP&A Business partner team and reporting to the FP&A Business partner lead, you will have the exciting opportunity to grow and develop as a finance professional. You will be in charge of providing financial support and expertise to the fast-growing Operations and Marketing teams.

lists.content:
• You will drive end-to-end the budget process within your scope (annual budget, reforecasts, monthly financial reviews)
  • You will act as a business partner to senior leaders: understand their needs, build and maintain advanced financial models to track business performance of various activities across
  • Operations and Marketing departments, provide financial support for 3rd-party contract negotiation
  • You will be accountable for the quality of the financial information related to your scope (monthly accruals design, variance analysis, model recalibrations, etc)
  • You will participate in ad hoc financial projects to support the growth of ManoMano
  • You will be a core user of our new reporting & forecasting platform (Pigment)

• 2+ years of relevant experience in Finance, with a track record in audit, transaction services or FP&A
  • Have strong analytical skills with a business-oriented profile
  • Have good communication skills (oral and written) and be able to present financial topics in a simple way to non-financial audiences 
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel / Google Sheet 
  • Knowledge of SQL is a plus
  • Speak French and English fluent

• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/
  • A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere
  • Work: office/ hybrid/ full remote is possible
  • Salary: competitive salary package
  • Technology: Get a laptop you love to do your best work

  • Retreats/ fun: music room/ a terrace/ modern office
  • Food: all the coffee you can drink/ Restaurant card (Swile)
  • Transportation: 50% reimbursement
  • MM employee discount
  • Parents: flexible policies

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European
leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY &
gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the
largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850
Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2,
Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity
and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

To consolidate its position as DIY and Gardening online leader, ManoMano has put
technology at the heart of its strategy.
We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering qualitatives products that we
will be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionise their online DIY experience.


As a fast growing company, we are always on the look for ingenious and passionate people.

Within the Marketing &
Data department, and directly reporting to the Head of Brand, Com, Media you will occupy a key position for the
organization, building, executing & monitoring our global go to market strategy in order to drive awareness and
consideration. 

Your missions:

Strategy & Vision: 
Lead & implement the Brand Marketing strategy delivering
against the company vision and business goals, for owned, earned & paid channels :
Brand advertising & experience
across the funnel
Partnerships & events : defining clear, bold partnership strategy 
Advocacy & communities : consumer
PR (France Only), influence & social community management
Content : developing global framework & scalability process,
acting as a product team sparring partner 
Operational Marketing: to support our commercial
performance

Implementation & scaling: 
Drive innovative, bold & ingenious global go-to-market strategies
Deliver
guidelines for international markets (FR/SP/IT/UK/DE), report progress / challenges, optimizations to maximize impact in
line with the company's customer-centric and data driven approach.
Measure and monitor our strategy impact and
effectiveness, including brand health metrics and campaign measurement), report back on results and recommendations for
improvements 
Develop processes, guidelines, audits etc. to ensure maximum ROI and global scaling. 
Manage budget with
100% accuracy & in full compliance with ManoMano guidelines
 
Leadership : 
Drive, empower & coach a team of high
performing specialists (5+ persons)
Drive global agencies to drive best in class results, and incremental growth
YoY
Lead without authority : Provide leadership and coordination for all initiatives with cross-functional partners
ensuring marketing & product integration 
Partner with Media Lead & Regional Marketing & Communications leads
(Northern/Southern Europe) ensuring consistency and maximum efficiency supporting regional needs & voice, as well as
their business ambition
Masterfully communicate up/down/across the organization to ensure transparency, alignment, and
advocacy of our strategy, cultivating strong collaborative relationships

Missions :

Manage Accounting & Tax activities

Manage all day to day accounting
activities (business accounting and general accounting) with a team of 5 employees 
Monitor and manage cash position
and cash flows
Review accounting operations, coordinate auditing processes, supervise production and ensure accuracy of
financial statements (monthly statements and quarterly / yearly closures)
Perform accounting deep dives on specific
topics and financial flows to ensure that our financial processes are compliant and efficient.
Manage all technical
accounting (IFRS and local GAAP), tax and compliance topics with internal and external stakeholders
Partner with our
external accounting teams to manage subsidiaries and intercompany flows

Run Accounting, Tax and Compliance
projects

Be responsible for running projects on any new tax or accounting regulations that could impact the
business
Implement and contribute to the ongoing development of systems, processes, internal controls and policies that
will scale with future growth
Review and challenge current Finance tooling architecture and identify opportunities to
optimize it
Be responsible for maintaining an always up to date and scalable Finance tooling environment

Manage and
grow the Accounting team

Create an efficient work environment 
Provide assistance and advice to the accounting staff
in their day to day work
Define and monitor employee objectives, assess and enhance performance, support skills
development and participate in employee career management

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Missions :

Manage Accounting & Tax activities

Manage all day to day accounting activities (business accounting and general accounting)  with a team of 5 employees 
Monitor and manage cash position and cash flows
Review accounting operations, coordinate auditing processes, supervise production and ensure accuracy of financial statements (monthly statements and quarterly / yearly closures)
Perform accounting deep dives on specific topics and financial flows to ensure that our financial processes are compliant and efficient.
Manage all technical accounting (IFRS and local GAAP), tax and compliance topics with internal and external stakeholders
Partner with our external accounting teams to manage subsidiaries and intercompany flows

Run Accounting, Tax and Compliance projects

Be responsible for running projects on any new tax or accounting regulations that could impact the business
Implement and contribute to the ongoing development of systems, processes, internal controls and policies that will scale with future growth
Review and challenge current Finance tooling architecture and identify opportunities to optimize it
Be responsible for maintaining an always up to date and scalable Finance tooling environment

Manage and grow the Accounting team

Create an efficient work environment 
Provide assistance and advice to the accounting staff in their day to day work
Define and monitor employee objectives, assess and enhance performance, support skills development and participate in employee career management

lists.content:
• Master Degree or equivalent degree in finance and accounting (DSCG, DEC , master CCA or higher school diploma in business or management..) 
  • 10+ years of experience including experience on a similar position with a successful operational financial experience preferably in a fast growing e commerce / digital environment 
  • Experience in top tier accounting firms or Big 4 companies
  • Demonstrable and successful experience in similar senior accounting & tax positions
  • Excellent knowledge of French GAAP, IFRS and Tax principles.
  • Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines
  • Ability to deal autonomously with multiple topics and objectives in a fast paced environment while giving visibility and involve others in key decisions 
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal in French and English
  • Advanced knowledge in Excel / Gsheet Prior experience with ERP systems (knowledge of Netsuite is a plus)Passionate about Finance IS and innovative Finance tooling solutions
  • Curious about business flows and tech: you will be partnering closely with business and tech teams and will be the senior contact for accounting matters of all departments of the company
  • Excellent team-management skills

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013,
ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the
largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano
brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We
currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4
offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and

Take a look
at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Sous le management du VP Commerce & International, le/la Head of
commerce experience & activation est chargé(e) du pilotage des projets merchandising, promotion et des projets relatifs
à l’expérience client sur le site. Il/elle est en charge de développer la vente de projets (au sens projets de travaux
donc vente de multi produits, de l’ensemble des composants par ex pour refaire sa salle de bain) 
Votre vision et votre
leadership vous permettront de travailler de manière étroite avec les équipes produits, CRM et acquisition, com, tech et
recrutement des vendeurs afin d’actionner:

Promotion: vous êtes chargé(e) du planning d’animation commercial et à ce
titre vous développez le Real Estate de visibilité et d’espace de communication sur tous les devices afin de valoriser
nos offres et gagner en impact en volume d’affaires. Vous travaillez aussi sur nos nouveaux services, offres de
financement et projets nous permettant de nous positionner comme un vrai spécialiste de la verticale DIY. 
- KPI : BV
Promo 

Merchandising: vous êtes en charge de la définition de la stratégie des labels pour aider nos clients à
naviguer dans notre catalogue de millions de produits afin de faciliter le choix et de favoriser l’upsell en étroite
collaboration avec les catman . Vous travaillez avec l’équipe Produit sur les features comme la comparaison des
produits, vous définissez la stratégie permettant d’optimiser notre taux de transformation (CVR) tout en nous
différenciant sur notre secteur. De même, vous bâtissez le plan d’activation et de développement de contenu clients pour
renforcer notre taux de conversion et positionnement de spécialiste tels que les avis clients (ratings, photos,..) et
leur stimulation en proche collaboration avec les équipes produits, CRM et category management. Coordonner avec les
équipes BtoB. 
- KPI : Panier moyen par pays

Projets & services: vous construisez en pleine collaboration avec les
équipes produits les projets de cross sell et bundling ainsi que les projets tels que rénovation de projets en
définissant les touchpoints clé dans le parcours client afin d’augmenter par trois le nombre de produits par panier
d’ici à 12 mois. De même, vous développez la stratégie pour améliorer le vente de projets sur le site (App à coordonner
avec équipe App) et piloter la performance des solutions produits et coordonner les plans d’activation marketing avec
les équipes acquisition / CRM / branding. 
- KPI : BV projets et nombre de produits au panier 

Votre expérience
e-commerce et votre connaissance clients sont autant d’atouts pour accompagner la croissance forte de Manomano en vous
appuyant sur le management de votre équipe promotion et projet. Vous êtes data driven et résolument orienté(e)
résultats, une forte capacité à structurer une approche méthodologique et une vision « growth » font de vous la personne
idoine pour performer au sein d’une organisation en pleine croissance avec des ambitions internationales
élevées.

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013,
ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the
largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano
brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We
currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4
offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and
(hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look
at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

OUR ENVIRONMENT :

ManoMano, already positioned as the European
leader in DIY, wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce.
For this, ManoMano is growing fast and is
looking for a Head of Engineering Platform (W/M) - Full remote in France.

The Platform perimeter is in charge of
:

- Core infrastructure components, backbone and edge
- Core engineering (tech tooling, bundle and sdk
development)
- Infrastructure-as-a-code governance
- Integration and delivery pipelines
- Developer eXperience and
workspace
- Authentication and Digital Identities
- Implementing the DevSecOps culture and SRE skills throughout the
Tech organization
- Building on-demand Platform services for development teams to increase their autonomy

The Head
of Engineering Platform is part of the Platform Train triad.
This Train is part of the Agile@Scale organization of
ManoMano and the triad is composed of : the Head of Engineering, a Product Director and an Agile Delivery
Leader.

This role is in charge of technically designing, architecturing and implementing Tech products and Business
requirements.

RESPONSIBILITIES :

Attached to the VP of Platform Engineering, you will be responsible for the
planning, execution and success of complex technological projects as well as ensuring the growth and achievement of
company goals and driving improvements on your perimeters. 

It is expected that you act as a mentor to help your
teams learn, progress at their best and deliver high quality products and services.
You are a pillar of the ManoMano
Tech & Engineering culture and expertise. 

Keys responsibilities include, although are not limited to : 

-
Managing managers and experts of the different sub-perimeters of the Platform (~60 engineers) in collaboration with the
Platform Product Director, setting objectives and creating suitable Personal Development Plans;
- Ensuring your teams
are high-performing and consistently and iteratively delivering high-impact, high quality work;
- Continuously
assessing your team’s approach and process maturity (with suitable techniques and metrics) to ensure a successful and
sustainable delivery;
- Ensuring your engineers and managers have the relevant skills (via training, coaching etc.) to
deliver tech & business priorities;
- Helping attract and recruit the best engineering talents;
- Ensuring, with your
teams, the quality of IT Operations (incident response, SLO…) of your perimeter; 
- Designing and implementing the
Platform Tech vision;
- Providing expertise to ensure platform performance, ecosystem integration and flexibility;
-
Auditing performance, security and reliability of core components;
- Enabling Platform evolutivity in order to answer
business needs, knowing when to stick with an old technology that works and when to move onto a new technology;
-
Ensuring delivery speed and quality of the Train, organized around iterations and demos; 
- Partnering with transversal
stakeholders to drive technical initiatives that improve our engineering practices;
- Coordinating the strategy with
other technical teams (Engineering managers, Lead developers community, Data team, QA team, Architect team...) in an
European context.

 At ManoMano we love and aspire to : 

- Push often and serenely to production;
- Software
craftsmanship: clean code, testing, peer programming, code review…;
- Monitor code and functionalities (mistakes,
product metrics);- Take advantage of containers flexibility;
- Leverage cloud scalability;
- Migrate to micro-services
and event-based architectures;
- Cultivating CI / CD and Agility. 

TECHNICAL STACK 
- Hosting: AWS
- Edge:
CloudFlare
- Containers: k8s (EKS)
- DevOps tooling: Ansible, Packer, Terraform, Consul, Vault, consul-template
-
Languages: Java / Kotlin, PHP, React & React native, NextJS, Go, Python
- Data: RDS (MariaDB, PgSQL, Aurora and
native), RabbitMQ, Kafka (MSK), Snowflake, S3
- Code & pipelines: Gitlab, gitlab-CI
- Workspace: Google Workspace,
Slack, Confluence / Jira, draw.io etc. 

REQUIREMENTS 
- Minimum 10 years of experience;
- Solid experience in
multiple technical teams management with management of managers and in project management;
- Soul of a leader and like
to drive ambitious projects;
- Creative / innovative & pragmatic (challenge “best practices”);
- Autonomous and
adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment);
- Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills, as
well as a good sense of humor :-);
- Like to communicate, curiosity, initiative, pragmatism in a collaborative and
challenging business & tech environment;
- Fluent in english;
- Broad and deep technical knowledge;
- Good
understanding of ops technologies;
- Experience with migrating, architecting, building, and deploying systems and
applications to a public Cloud;
- Understanding of the stakes of the company (DIY best in class platform & services,
customer experience, e-commerce, data driven…);
- Experience in technical design, implementing enterprise software
solutions.

The Head of Engineering Platform is part of the Platform Train triad.

- Containers: k8s (EKS)
- DevOps tooling: Ansible, Packer, Terraform, Consul, Vault, consul-template
- Languages: Java / Kotlin, PHP, React & React native, NextJS, Go, Python
- Data: RDS (MariaDB, PgSQL, Aurora and native), RabbitMQ, Kafka (MSK), Snowflake, S3
- Code & pipelines: Gitlab, gitlab-CI
- Workspace: Google Workspace, Slack, Confluence / Jira, draw.io etc. 

REQUIREMENTS 
- Minimum 10 years of experience;
- Solid experience in multiple technical teams management with management of managers and in project management;
- Soul of a leader and like to drive ambitious projects;
- Creative / innovative & pragmatic (challenge “best practices”);
- Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment);
- Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills, as well as a good sense of humor :-);
- Like to communicate, curiosity, initiative, pragmatism in a collaborative and challenging business & tech environment;
- Fluent in english;
- Broad and deep technical knowledge;
- Good understanding of ops technologies;
- Experience with migrating, architecting, building, and deploying systems and applications to a public Cloud;
- Understanding of the stakes of the company (DIY best in class platform & services, customer experience, e-commerce, data driven…);

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Background & Missions

ManoMano, already positioned as European leader in DIY,
wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. For this, ManoMano is growing fast and is looking for an
Engineering Manager in Paris to support multiple teams on the Buyers tribe. 

These teams are in charge of the
platform managing transaction flows at ManoMano; from customer payment to seller’s invoicing and
compliance.


RESPONSABILITIES

You will be in charge of a tribe, composed of 4 teams, in order to create, in
collaboration with the product and UX / UI teams, an amazing experience for the merchants and the customer.

Your
mission is to manage complex technology projects, ensure the growth and achievement of your team's goals and drive
improvements on your teams’ perimeters.

It is expected that you act as a mentor to help your teams grow and deliver
high quality products and services.

You will ensure that projects are on track and work closely with ManoMano
developers and technical teams to make the things happen !

Work closely with product teams to build the best products
for our customers and merchants.

You will be responsible for the planning, execution and success of complex
technological projects: it also has the function of anticipating blockers and being the one who will make life easier
for the teams !

Be the guarantor of the ManoMano Tech culture, make it live and make sure your teams are happy to
come every morning.

You will collaborate with ManoMano Talent Team to recruit the best developers to complete your
teams

Technical stack :
- Microservices
- Java >= 8 with SpringBoot 2 / Kotlin
- PHP >= 7 with Symfony 3.4 & 4
-
React (Next.js)
- MySQL, Postgre
- RabbitMQ, Kafka
- Redis
- Git / Gitlab
- AWS

REQUIREMENTS
 
- Minimum 10
years of experience
- A solid experience in technical teams management (more than 8 people) and in project
management
- Previous experience as Senior Lead Developer / Engineering Manager ideally
- Relevant experience in
building payment systems or transaction management systems
- Soul of a leader and like to drive ambitious projects
-
Creative / Innovative
- Data Driven in decision making
- Fluent in english
- Autonomous and adaptable (able to work
in a constantly changing environment)
- Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills, as well as a good sense of
humor!
- Curious with a strong desire to test and experiment new solutions in your work
- New technologies /
e-commerce have no secrets for you

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

MAIN MISSIONS 

In a fast moving and hypergrowth context, You are responsible for
all subjects dedicated to Change Management (new ways of working, support to senior leaders while changing their
organization) and to Development Programs (Learning, Leaders & Managers development and coaching & mentoring) to support
ManoMano hypergrowth while feeding and reinforcing its culture uniqueness. 

More specifically your main activities
will include :

Organization Development & Change management : 

You will lead a portfolio of transformation
programs and change management activities within the company : Support to senior leaders in engaging their teams in new
organizations (change management plan, workshops design and animation etc) ; Reinventing collaboration in a hybrid
working environment (30% of employees in full remote across 2 countries, new ways of working).

You will develop a set
of “organization development & change management” methodology & tools and will train and equip leaders to support the
company at scale. 

Learning & Development : 

You will lead the program of designing and implementing an ambitious
and unique Managerial & Leadership culture across the organization, in an inclusive way

You will be accountable for
the learning program offer (e-learning, blended learning, management and leadership) and for developing a learning
environment, addressing and anticipating new collective and individual needs

You will be responsible for developing
an efficient program of coaching and of mentoring within ManoMano

You will manage a team of 3
people

You will be accountable for the learning program offer (e-learning, blended learning, management and leadership) and for developing a learning environment, addressing and anticipating new collective and individual needs

You will be responsible for developing an efficient program of coaching  and of mentoring within ManoMano

You will manage a team of 3 people

lists.content:
• University degree or equivalent experience10+ years of experience (consultancy and company), ideally in a tech or scale environnement
  • Experience in organizational change management consulting (internal or external consulting - mastering change management and engagement tools) and one or more of the following transformation practice areas : Leadership, Management, Culture,…
  • You have the capacity to fastly identify the adequate tools and methodology depending on the project
  • You have a real leadership, a great capacity to understand needs and to engage your stakeholders
  • You have an excellent communication to carry ambitious transformational projects such as building a Managerial Culture.
  • You have a great ability to connect, collaborate with and engage a large range of stakeholders, including senior leaders of the organization
  • Experience in management with a collaborative and care approach 
  • Analytical with emotional intelligence, able to work effectively in a in fast-paced environmentEnglish and French fluent.

descriptionPlain:
Launched in
2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United
Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities,
working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3
core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.


Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoFulfillment is a strategic pillar of ManoMano
growth. It enables sellers - from all around the world - to benefit from ManoMano best in class logistic experience and
grow their sales across europe. When sellers join the ManoFulfillment program, they benefit from a sales uplift thanks
to a better customer promise (free shipping, express delivery, large choice of delivery options, etc).
MF growth team
is in charge of (a) commercialising this service to our sellers and (b) developing the tools we provide to them to
operate their business. Our goal is to increase as much as possible the value proposition by easing their life through
exhaustive and easy-to-use tools, and sharing actionable insights.
description:

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoFulfillment is a strategic pillar of ManoMano growth. It enables sellers - from all around the world - to benefit from ManoMano best in class logistic experience and grow their sales across europe. When sellers join the ManoFulfillment program, they benefit from a sales uplift thanks to a better customer promise (free shipping, express delivery, large choice of delivery options, etc).
MF growth team is in charge of (a) commercialising this service to our sellers and (b) developing the tools we provide to them to operate their business. Our goal is to increase as much as possible the value proposition by easing their life through exhaustive and easy-to-use tools, and sharing actionable insights.

lists.content:
• Be the leader of promoting the ManoFulfillment service to manomano sellers
    • Own the vision, the strategy, the sales cycle, and the P&L (co-owned with ops).
    Understand our sellers needs and the competitive environment to identify new opportunities and improve the value proposition.
    Help shaping the right organisation and work closely with all stakeholders (in particular the product teams and the fulfillment ops teams) to build a best in class service and reach our vision.

  • Grow and drive a sales team to achieve our goals
    • Manage and grow a sales team, expert of our ManoFulfillment program. Ensure they are properly trained (the best to pitch our solutions) and have the right tools to commercialise our services.
    Ensure they are equipped for success, result driven oriented, with clear priorities.
    Identify sellers with the highest potential, pitch them the ManoFulfillment proposition, integrate and accompany them to grow their sales

  • Develop the tools we provide to our sellers to ensure adoption
    • Put yourself in the shoes of our sellers to set up the easiest possible experience for them
    Work closely with the sellers and the product teams to improve our tools and develop new ones

  • Drive strategic projects to improve the value proposition for both customers and sellers
    • Responsible to ensure best visibility of the ManoFulfilment service on the platforms for our customers
    In charge of the pricing of the service

• Solid track record in delivering strong sales results
  • Relevant experience in management of a sales team
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Strong analytical capabilities with a process improvement mentality
  • Ease at pitching and negotiating with business owners and senior leadership
  • You are results oriented (and have already proven it)
  • You have the intellect and horsepower to solve really complex problems
  • You operate well in an ambiguous environment
  • You want to accomplish big things and challenge yourself and others to think differently and take risks
  • You are an innovator.
  • You love doing more with less, it pushes you to find innovative solutions

• Fast growing start-up environment
  • International & agile company 
  • Possible full remote
  • Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
  • DIY workshops and internal events
  • Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Barcelona & Bordeaux
  • 7 weeks holidays/year
  • Tickets restaurant

Au sein du département Commerce & International de ManoMano, vous êtes la pierre
angulaire du sujet de la performance commerciale sein de ManoMano pour aider à définir nos actions commerciales et viser
à l’amélioration de notre taux de transformation (CVR)

Vous reportez directement au VP Commerce & International
Growth et à ce titre, vous êtes son véritable bras droit pour tous les sujets relatifs à la performance commerciale dans
les différents pays, l’évaluation des performances des promotions et différentes activités de développement commerciales
(partenariat,…)

Vous travaillez de manière étroite avec les équipes promotion, les country managers et les category
managers ainsi qu’avec toutes les équipes transverses ayant un impact direct sur notre CVR.

Profil : 

Vous avez un
vrai leadership et un vrai sens business pour apporter votre vision à nos différente initiatives commerce.
Doté(e)
d’une solide expérience sur toute les questions de performance commerciale (contrôle de gestion commercial, business
analyst commerce,…), vous avez des expériences significatives chez un distributeur, idéalement dans le monde
DIY/bricolage et vous avez une vraie capacité à prendre de la hauteur sur les problématiques tout en les comprenant
opérationnellement.

descriptionPlain:
Launched
in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United
Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities,
working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3
core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.


Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Product organization at ManoMano is divided into 6 Gears
(Mega-Tribe)
 
SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their business (main KPI: seller
revenues)
COMMERCE & CLIENTS: Help customer discover what they need (North Star Metric : add2cart rate)
PROJECTS &
SERVICES: Help the customer to set up his own project with advice. We will propose some new service dedicated to
DIY
OPERATIONS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring delivery and after sales experience (main KPI: NPS and
CSAT)
MONEY: Provide a secure & best-in class pay-in and pay-out experience (main KPI: Payment CVR & Compliance)
BTOB:
Transform the DIY marketplace to help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main KPI: B2B repurchase rate)


The OPERATIONS Gear includes 3 Tribes:
Customer Care, Delivery & Fulfillment
 
Your mission as a Head of Product is
to ensure that all FTs deliver a coherent product roadmap impacting business through differentiating features:
 
The
job reports to the VP of Product.
 
Your main missions will consist of 
 
1- Product discovery
- Master the problem
space of your tribe through a deep knowledge of your users pain points and needs through qualitative research (assisted
by our user research department) or quantitative data (NPS results, Customer Effort Score verbatims).
- Define
strategic user research priorities to be sure to tackle the main problem spaces. 
 
2- Product strategy
- Build and
nurture the product vision with your PMs, based on the data you gathered (from users, your team, data analysis,
competitors, user research…)
- Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap: you will make sure that the PMs
are building the right features
- Make sure your team / stakeholders understand and embrace it through your engaging
communication 
- Integrate the product strategy within the company strategy
- Provide regular feedback and communicate
the vision to the leadership team.
 
3- Product delivery
- Coordinate the FTs through your macro view and be able to
call for cross teams solutions and anticipate dependencies. You also coordinate with other Lead PMs to ensure that we
all go into the same direction. You work closely with the Gear EM (Engineering Manager) and architect team to ensure
roadmap feasibility and anticipate the next priorities. Spread your tribe knowledge from one FT to another.
- Be
obsessed by the impact of the features the FT of your tribe ship through A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate
insights about your product (with user researchers’ help)
- Communicate in a timely manner with the VP Product and your
main stakeholders about important information, alerts, etc. 
 
4 - Management & leadership
- Influence: you represent
the gear in company strategic meetings and strategic product meetings. You are able to drive complicated decisions where
several stakeholders are involved taking into account each one point of view. You can challenge the business
requirements. 
- Coach and train: make the PMs grow. You help the PM to become autonomous and impact driven. Assist
them during their main ceremonies, have regular 1:1, share your experience, clarify their mission...
- Review and
assess: set clear objectives (we use the OKR methodology), monitor the PMs performance regularly and review each quarter
the PMs performance 
 
Expected skills
Hard skills: 
- Proven product management experience: you can demonstrate a
significant experience in product area (8+ years ideally) and you have a strong track record of achievements both on
-
Delivery: you structured product organization, made teams grow, improved delivery process
- Strategy and discovery: you
have success stories backed by hard data where your product initiatives created a significant business difference


Project management : you can anticipate potential risks (technical, operational, legal or business), you always are
one step ahead of current advancement, you are able to zoom in to solve operational problems as well as to zoom out to
present a clear strategic roadmap. You always fight complexity
 
Communication : be it written or oral, you are able
to express clearly technical or business problems. You have a strong synthesis capacity. You are able to adapt your
communication to the person you are talking to. Empathy is one of your strength, and you are able to calm down
discussions when people disagree.
 
Management and leadership : you proved to be a leader even on a small team, you
are able to get the most of your colleagues and make them grow. 
 
E-commerce expertise: you have worked in an
e-commerce environment and you know well the basics (catalog management, search, logistics, payments…), you are familiar
with marketplace concepts (supply, demand, network effect…). 
 
Soft skills: 
Agility, Speed and Entrepreneurial fire
: experience in strong growth environment where company changes every 6 months, ability to pivot quickly or take
decision with only 80% of the information
 
Data driven : not only can you perform basic data analysis through tools
like Amplitude or basic queries via SQL but your mind is data biased. Every project you launch start with KPI definition
and target. You see data as a strategic asset for the company and you try to maximize it in every project you start (eg
with Machine Learning learning features)
 
Bold, ingenious and care : these are the 3 ManoMano values, they are a
prerequisite to join us ! 
 
DIY (bonus): you are found of DIY, refurbishing an apartment or a house is part of your
hobbies, this is great !
 
If you started your own company (even if a failure), this is an extra bonuses ! English is
also a prerequisite.

description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Within the Legal Department and reporting directly to the Head of Legal of ManoMano, you will be in charge of the elaboration of the Public Affairs strategy of the company, in close collaboration with the Eteam and the Communication Department of Manomano.

lists.content:
• More specifically, you will be responsible for : 

  • Managing relations with the company's Public Affairs Agency 
  • Ensure political, regulatory and media monitoring of future regulations with a strong impact on the company (reports, agendas, roadmap, mapping, etc.)
  • Organize, prepare and participate in institutional meetings (Parliament, Federations, Ministries, etc.)
  • Write internal analysis notes, arguments, external position papers or review the position papers of the Public Affairs Agency, FEVAD or E-commerce Europe 
  • Participate in national, European or international working groups, in particular the FEVAD and E-commerce Europe working groups  
  • Collaborate and/or lead coalitions formed with other actors 
  • Collaborate with the Communication department to enable them to design and execute communication, press, social networks and influence actions in line with our public affairs strategy

    • Permanent position to be filled as soon as possible

• At least 10/12 years of experience in public affairs, preferably in the public sphere or in consulting Law and/or political science background
  • Excellent knowledge of French public influence networks (national and regional) and ability to activate them 
  • Excellent knowledge of the French and European legislative process and public law
  • Ability to work in project modeAbility to speak in public, regardless of the format used
  • Excellent writing skills in both French and English
  • Ability to develop and influence a professional network Experience in the marketplaces sector and/or digital sector would be a plus
  • A strong sense of confidentiality
  • A caring, team player who supports his/her manager
  • Leadership, ability to adapt to various contacts while taking into account their business differences
  • A taste for challenges and an ability to evolve in a hyper-growth company (i.e. in a constantly changing professional environment)

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in
DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As a marketplace specialized in the Home Improvement industry operating in Europe,
ManoMano is disrupting the German market since 2016. This market is a priority for us as it is the first largest country
in Europe in our industry and the more mature in e-commerce providing huge growth opportunities for us. ManoMano is
looking for a Head of Sellers' Partnership Germany, responsible for the development of our sourcing strategy and playing
a key role on ManoMano success.
Within the Sellers' Partnership team and reporting to the Senior Vice President
Sellers' Partnership, you will be responsible for the management of the German market business development team which is
in charge of the sourcing of new sellers and the support of our existing ones. Missions include defining your own
strategy, grow and accompany your team, be representative for ManoMano in the German Market.
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As a marketplace specialized in the Home Improvement industry operating in Europe, ManoMano is disrupting the German market since 2016. This market is a priority for us as it is the first largest country in Europe in our industry and the more mature in e-commerce providing huge growth opportunities for us. ManoMano is looking for a Head of Sellers' Partnership Germany, responsible for the development of our sourcing strategy and playing a key role on ManoMano success.
Within the Sellers' Partnership team and reporting to the Senior Vice President Sellers' Partnership, you will be responsible for the management of the German market business development team which is in charge of the sourcing of new sellers and the support of our existing ones. Missions include defining your own strategy, grow and accompany your team, be representative for ManoMano in the German Market.

lists.content:
• Business Development strategy
  • Define and run the best strategy for the German market, in line with the global strategy, to ensure the achievement of our goals
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders and key partners in the German market, to ensure our position as leading marketplace in the Home Improvement industry
  • Identify, partner and accompany the top sellers of our industry, from local distributors to international players
  • Be able to challenge existing practices and provide strategic input impacting ManoMano as a whole
  • Work closely with other departments to ensure a coherent strategy in the German market

  • Manage, structure and drive your team
  • Be accountable for your team results
  • Manage and inspire a growing German team in Paris. Act as a leader and a mentor to grow individuals
  • Find,  hire and accompany the best talents
  • Define personal and teams' OKR, define and implement budget and processes that shape the organization. Set business priorities and deploy them with your team
  • Be able to drive several ManoMano teams to work together. In all cases, set a good dynamic between your team and the rest of the company & demonstrate care within your team.

• Competent and business oriented leader with minimum 10 years of relevant experience in business development, management and ecommerce, used to communicate clearly and effectively (written & verbal) with business leaders, able to lead and carry teams and ambitious projects
  • German native speaker
  • Excellent digital culture & deep understanding of the marketplace business models
  • Proven successful track record growing a business, market planning/analysis and opportunity identification
  • Strong organizational planning and development skills
  • Be able to drive projects, tackle complex situations, always using data, coordinate and develop teams
  • Bac +5 graduated from a Engineering School, University-degree in Economics, International Business or similar
  • Data Driven, people know you for your analytical and synthetic mind
  • Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment)
  • Curious, with a strong desire to learn
  • Proactive, collaborative and solutions oriented
  • Knowledge of German DIY industry and market landscape would be an additional plus

• Fast growing start-up environment
  • International & agile company 
  • Possible full remote
  • Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
  • DIY workshops and internal events
  • Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Barcelona & Bordeaux
  • 7 weeks holidays/year in France or 30 days/year in Germany
  • Tickets restaurant
  • Health insurance
  • Parenthood policy

additionalPlain:
Background
& Missions
ManoMano, already positioned as European leader in DIY, wants to propose the best online experience in DIY
ecommerce. Our company is growing fast and wants to structure its teams. We are looking for a Java Backend Developer in
Barcelona to join a feature team on one of the Buyers perimeter. 
This team is in charge of the customer experience
around shipments. Leveraging on services to track customer packages during their delivery journey and providing a
service to return a defective or inappropriate product easily.
At ManoMano we love and aspire to :
- Push often and
serenely to production
- Software craftsmanship: clean code, testing, peer programming, code review…
- Monitor code
and functionalities (mistakes, product metrics)
- Take advantage of containers flexibility (docker)
- Leverage cloud
scalability (AWS)
- Migrate to micro-services and event-based architectures
- Cultivating CI / CD and Agility


Responsibilities
You will join a team, composed of 2 to 5 members, in order to create, in collaboration with the
product and UX / UI teams, an amazing experience for the merchants and the customers.
As a software engineer in this
team, you will have to : 
-Design and develop features with a high quality standard
-Assimilate business context and
company expectations to be creative and relevant
-Learn & teach through code reviews and the sharing of good
practices
-Improve the quality and testing of technical components
-Deploy your code up to production and be involved
in monitoring it

Technical stack :
-Microservices
-Java >= 8 with SpringBoot 2 / Kotlin
-React (Next.js)
-MySQL,
Postgres
-RabbitMQ, Kafka
-RedisGit 
-Gitlab
-AWS 

Requirements- 
+3 years of experience as a Backend Developer
in JAVA language.
- High knowledge of Java 8 or higher.
- High understanding of Micro-service Architecture
(spring-boot, docker).
- Knowledge in Restful API & Event Sourcing (Kafka, RabbitMQ ...)
- High level of English. 
-
Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment)
- Team spirit and excellent interpersonal
skills, as well as a good sense of humor!
- Curious with a strong desire to test and experiment new solutions in your
work
- New technologies / e-commerce have no secrets for you
Nice to have 
- Kotlin >= 1.4 with SpringBoot 2 (Java
>=11). 
- PHP Knowledge 
- Previous experience in AWS Cloud
- Working experience in Gitlab, JIRA and Slack


Benefits 
· Permanent contract.
· 30 working days of holidays.
· Full flexibility policy. Choose the days you
want to come to the office!
· Flexible working hours
· Career development: 4 weekly hours dedicated to training with
digital and interactive platforms. English trainings included. 
· Medical assurance provided by AXA (full paid by the
company).
· Gym provided by Andjoy (full paid by the company).
· Ticket restaurant and ticket transport provided by
Sodexo (flexible remuneration).
· ManoMano monthly discounts.
· Online and onsite workshops, meetups, team buildings
and company meetings. 
· Social responsible and sustainable actions like Women in Tech, IT Academy (converting profiles
to the IT sector), participation to a Food Bank, Clothes Bank, KM0 providers, Recycling, Sustainable Offices, among
others.

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader
specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening
online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer
across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos,
including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and
Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and
care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to
put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

You will join the Legal Department, headed by Manomano's Head of Legal, and work
under the supervision of the Senior IP/IT legal counsel.

 You will deal with issues relating mainly to intellectual
property law, digital law (e-commerce, platform regulation), contract law (services, licensing, integration, etc.) and
communication and advertising law.

 Your missions will include, in particular : 

- Assistance in managing the
company's intellectual property rights portfolio, supported by our attorneys; 

- Management of pre-litigation and
litigation in the field of intellectual property (counterfeiting, unfair competition, parasitism, trademark oppositions,
UDRP actions, etc.);

- Participation in the protection and defence strategy of the company's intangible assets
(domain names, trademarks, copyright, etc.);
Support and advice to operational teams (communication, brand, marketing,
tech, product, data, B2B, etc....); 

- Review and negotiation of various contracts, particularly in the context of
calls for tender (service contracts, SaaS, integration, licences, partnerships, contracts with media agencies,
advertisers, influencers, etc.);

- Conducting internal training and workshops for operational teams (e.g. on the
liability regime applicable to e-commerce platforms, contractual negotiation, etc.); 

- Assistance in implementing
standard processes and templates (letters, contracts, best practices, etc.) for operational teams.

You will also be
responsible for monitoring the evolution of French and European regulations applicable to our business, particularly in
the areas of intellectual property law, platform regulation, advertising law and contract law.The evolving nature of the
position may lead you to deal with legal issues related to other areas of law (commercial law, consumer law, data
protection law, etc.).
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

You will join the Legal Department, headed by Manomano's Head of Legal, and work under the supervision of the Senior IP/IT legal counsel.

 You will deal with issues relating mainly to intellectual property law, digital law (e-commerce, platform regulation), contract law (services, licensing, integration, etc.) and communication and advertising law.

 Your missions will include, in particular : 

- Assistance in managing the company's intellectual property rights portfolio, supported by our attorneys;

- Management of pre-litigation and litigation in the field of intellectual property (counterfeiting, unfair competition, parasitism, trademark oppositions, UDRP actions, etc.);

- Participation in the protection and defence strategy of the company's intangible assets (domain names, trademarks, copyright, etc.);
Support and advice to operational teams (communication, brand, marketing, tech, product, data, B2B, etc....); 

- Review and negotiation of various contracts, particularly in the context of calls for tender (service contracts, SaaS, integration, licences, partnerships, contracts with media agencies, advertisers, influencers, etc.);

- Conducting internal training and workshops for operational teams (e.g. on the liability regime applicable to e-commerce platforms, contractual negotiation, etc.); 

- Assistance in implementing standard processes and templates (letters, contracts, best practices, etc.) for operational teams.

You will also be responsible for monitoring the evolution of French and European regulations applicable to our business, particularly in the areas of intellectual property law, platform regulation, advertising law and contract law.The evolving nature of the position may lead you to deal with legal issues related to other areas of law (commercial law, consumer law, data protection law, etc.).

lists.content:
• Are you autonomous, rigorous and a team player ? Do you have previous experience in the digital or e-commerce sector ? Do you like to take on big challenges ? Then we are made to work together !
  • In addition :
  • You have a Master 2 (ideally in IP/IT and/or contracts), LLM and/or the CAPA ;
  • You have at least 3 to 5 years' experience (excluding internships) in a company and/or law firm;  
  • You are fluent in English and ideally in one additional language of the countries in which Manomano operates (Spain, Italy or Germany);You are reactive and proactive, agile and resourceful; 
  • You are rigorous and organised, you know how to prioritise your tasks and carry out your assignments within the given deadlines;
  • You are a caring, team player who supports your manager;
  • You have good interpersonal skills and know how to adapt to your various contacts, taking into account their professional differences.

lists.text:
As a Key Account Manager, you will be responsible for
top and bottom line results of your portfolio :
lists.content:
• Management of a Key sellers portfolio identifying sales opportunities to make grow overall business,
  • Advise and continuously negotiate on selection, pricing competitiveness and stock management,
  • Identify and provide advice on how to improve any business input that drive growth and improve end customer experience,
  • Create a dedicated and personalized commercial relationship,
  • Follow closely the performances indicators to optimise the sales growth,

    • Build long term relationships with sellers across your portfolio:
  • Act as an advisor to improve your portfolio performance,
  • Engage sellers and frequently share valuable insights to them,
  • Proactively build joint business plans,
  • Continuously negotiate better partnership terms for ManoMano,
  • Act as a point of escalation for seller issues, questions, or concerns

• 3+ years of experience working in sales, account management, buying, consulting or marketing/merchandising,
  • Strong understanding of the e-commerce and the retail industry,
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with senior business leaders,
  • Data driven with strong analytical skills,
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel. SQL is a strong plus,
  • Autonomous and adaptable, able to work in a constantly changing environment
  • Fluent in French and English both written and spoken,

• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere
  • Work: office/ hybrid/ full remote  
  • Salary: competitive salary package
  • Technology: Get a laptop you love to do your best work
  • Time off: 7 weeks of paid vacation + vacation premium $$
  • Sports: free gym 
  • Healthcare: mutual (60% taken care by MM) 
  • Retreats/ fun: music room/ a terrace/ modern office/  Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge, learn from others)/ External events attendance, fairs & Meetups, DYI workshops
  • Food: all the coffee you can drink/ Restaurant card (Swile)
  • Transportation: 50% reimbursement
  • MM employee discount
  • Parents: flexible policies

Within the German Sellers Partnership Team and reporting
to the Head of Business Development, you will occupy a position in a key division for ManoMano's growth.

As a Brands
Account Manager, you will define and run the Brand strategy for ManoMano Germany, in line with the Sellers Partnership
Team strategy, to ensure the achievement of the goals. 

You will manage the business relationship with some of our
key brand partners and will be responsible for driving top and bottom line results of your portfolio. Dealing on a daily
basis with executive managers of key brands, you will build and drive exceptional relationships with them and help them
thrive their business through ManoMano. 
You will also be a pillar to support new brand launches on ManoMano by
providing valuable insights and guidelines to make sure the launch is a success.

Your missions :

-Define and run
the Brand strategy
-Implement new partnerships with brands
-Build and manage strong relationships with our key
manufacturer partners
-Develop trade marketing and promotional activities (define calendar, build product selection,
negotiate outstanding & exclusive deals, analyse the results)
-Work closely with the Brand Account Managers of the
other countries (FR, IT, ES and UK) to ensure a coherent and common strategy, harmonise the processes and share best
practises 
-Drive sales and margin improvement of your portfolio
-Constantly negotiate the best commercial
terms
-Optimize product pricing and all other levers to increase sales
-Accelerate the adoption of our value added
services (marketing, sponsored products, logistics, billing, ...)
-Provide business insights, training and manufacturer
education
-Analyze business performances and conduct in-depth analysis to identify growth opportunities
-Help
manufacturers prioritize business opportunities
-Set yearly/quarterly/monthly objectives and action plans to achieve
and exceed goals

Agile & international environment with bright and friendly colleagues
Telework possible two days / week
The international dimension (France, Italy, Spain, United Kingdom, Germany)
A pleasant setting in Paris in more than 3,000 m² (a gym, a terrace, a music room)
An atmosphere (average age 31)

We're actively seeking applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

If all the above rings a bell, it probably means that we are meant to meet each other ! Please get in touch.« So, come and plant the seeds of your success and gather the fruits of your labour »

The information collected on this form is recorded in a file used by ManoMano - Colibri SAS so that we can process your application.   
The data is kept for 2 years from the date of your application. You can access your data, rectify it, request its deletion or exercise your right to limit the processing of your data. You can also exercise your right to the portability of your data. Consult the cnil.fr website for more information on your rights. 
To exercise these rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data under this scheme, you can contact our data protection officer by writing to dpo@manomano.com.  
If, after having contacted us, you feel that your "Data Protection" rights have not been respected, you may submit a complaint to the CNIL.
