lists.content:
• Own & Define Mano Fulfillment Growth strategy over your countries:
  • Propose & define commercial strategies to develop the Mano Fulfillment program in your countries.
  • Design and implement projects to improve the program: onboarding, catalogue increase, stock management, etc...
  • Build, grow and lead a fast-growing account management team to achieve Mano Fulfillment ambitious revenue objectives.
  • Build analytical tools to monitor the Mano Fulfillment account management team performance.
  • Be the voice of the sellers for the Fulfillment program with all internal stakeholders including tech team to create an outstanding seller experience

• Bac +5 graduated from a Top Business/Engineering School (or equivalent university education)
  • Sales oriented leader with minimum 6 years of relevant experience, with at least 2 years of management experience, preferably with an online marketplace
  • Strong understanding of the ecommerce and the retail industry
  • Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and key partners
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively (written & verbal) with senior business leaders
  • Excellence in Excel with very strong analytical skills required
  • Autonomous business driven, strong rigour in the workplace
  • Curious and passionate about innovation in Ecommerce/Marketplace
  • Fluency in English and French, other language is a plus

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the
European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of
DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850
Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2,
Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity
and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoFulfillment is a strategic pillar of ManoMano growth. It enables sellers - from
all around the world - to benefit from ManoMano best in class logistic experience and grow their sales across europe.
When sellers join the ManoFulfillment program, they benefit from a sales uplift thanks to a better customer promise
(free shipping, express delivery, large choice of delivery options, etc).
MF growth team is in charge of (a)
commercialising this service to our sellers and (b) developing the tools we provide to them to operate their business.
Our goal is to increase as much as possible the value proposition by easing their life through exhaustive and
easy-to-use tools, and sharing actionable insights.

As the Lead Business Project Manager for Mano Fulfilment Growth
you are part of the Mano Fulfilment Growth team and work closely with the Head of Mano Fulfilment Growth. You are
passionate about growing businesses. You will play a critical role, working transversally with many teams. You will
directly drive different kind of projects such as (a) product/tech projects (ex: improve toolings for the sellers,
improve the features), (b) business projects (ex: review the program pricing) or (c) efficiency/scale projects (ex:
align process of teams).

Our goal is to increase as much as possible the value proposition by easing their life through exhaustive and easy-to-use tools, and sharing actionable insights.

As the Lead Business Project Manager for Mano Fulfilment Growth you are part of the Mano Fulfilment Growth team and work closely with the Head of Mano Fulfilment Growth. You are passionate about growing businesses. You will play a critical role, working transversally with many teams. You will directly drive different kind of projects such as (a) product/tech projects (ex: improve toolings for the sellers, improve the features), (b) business projects (ex: review the program pricing) or (c) efficiency/scale projects (ex: align process of teams).

lists.content:
• Lead key projects to improve seller experience (features, business, efficiency/scale), 
  • Ensure visibility & tracking of the project’s advancement,
  • Create goals and related metrics, track progress and manage through obstacles to achieve your objectives,
  • Gain support for your strategy and roadmap from stakeholders by writing narratives and influencing peers and senior leadership,
  • Dive deep on issues and come up with solutions, working with product teams for long-term implementation,
  • Addressing barriers through problem solving and coordination with stakeholders,
  • Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make trade-offs and balance the business needs versus technical constraint,
  • Identify gaps and pain points in the existing processes and drive improvements,
  • Identify and analyze to isolate issues, test solutions and prioritize competing program opportunities,
  • Conceptualize and drive program changes.

• At least 6 years of experience with demonstrated experience in program/project management,
  • Cross-team coordination, project management,
  • Executive communication, and presentation skills,
  • Ability to understand logistic, to be able to work with the logistics team when defining the need, support exploration, challenge them, and join problem solving in case of problem/deviation,
  • Ability to scale a business, identify opportunities, define and market an offer to sellers,
  • Structure and simplify complex problems, 
  • Strong analytical abilities,
  • Results oriented,
  • Able to operate in an ambiguous environment (early stage program),
  • You want to accomplish big things and challenge yourself and others to think differently and take risks,
  • You are an innovator. You love doing more with less, it pushes you to find innovative solutions.

• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere
  • Work: office/ hybrid/ full remote  
  • Salary: competitive salary package
  • Technology: Get a laptop you love to do your best work
  • Time off: 7 weeks of paid vacation + vacation premium $$
  • Sports: free gym 
  • Healthcare: mutual (60% taken care by MM) 
  • Retreats/ fun: music room/ a terrace/ modern office/  Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge, learn from others)/ External events attendance, fairs & Meetups, DYI workshops
  • Food: all the coffee you can drink/ Restaurant card (Swile)
  • Transportation: 50% reimbursement
  • MM employee discount
  • Parents: flexible policies

descriptionPlain:
Launched in
2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United
Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities,
working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3
core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.


Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

We are willing to take it to the next level on the DIY,
Home Improvement and Garden markets. This means, among other things, reinforcing our commercial performance, with a
multispecialist, category driven mindset. As part of the Commercial Performance team, you report directly to the Senior
Lead E-commerce. Your main responsibility is to manage the French Catman and E-merchandiser team in order to drive the
catalog performance at the country level to help ManoMano achieve their business goals. You are an experienced manager,
a true market expert and you bring your previous experience of e-commerce or project management to reinforce our
capabilities.

Your missions are the following:

Management:
You are responsible for the French category management
and e-merchandising team: you co-build and implement the yearly strategies and roadmaps, improve tools and processes and
make your teams and (above all) team members grow (5 catmans to date + 1 e-merchandiser)

Category management: 
You
are in charge of reaching the turnover targets at family level; you report on the performance and identify action plans.

Your responsibilities involve:
Catalog strategy: identify the priorities for the company; you define and execute the
cross team strategy (involving sourcing, logistics, product etc.)
Catalog development: you identify opportunities to
develop our catalog (at product, category or brand level); you generate leads to the sourcing teams and monitor their
activation.
Catalog performance: monitoring of key performance indicators, analysis of traffic, usage & purchasing
behavior to improve performance. You report in the weekly business review the performance with a family prism and
identify action plan to reach the targets. 

E-Merchandising: 
You have the responsibility to define and operate how
we sell our products on the website and adapt the purchasing experience to the category and the customers expectations:
Administrate the taxonomy, the filters (orders, values) and the features helping customers find their products on
listings (guided navigation filters). Collaboration with the Feature Teams for the co-development of new merchandising
functionalities. 

Promotion: 
You work closely with the promotion team to push and animate selections of our catalog
with local specificities, in order to bring additional value to our visitors and generate additional turnover.


Profile : 

You already have several years of experience (min 5years) as a manager on similar commercial
responsibilities. You know the retail or e-commerce and the HI environment and you are at ease with project management.
You are curious, bold and looking for a new challenge, in a fast paced, international environment. You are solution and
results oriented and you respond effectively to deadlines. Thanks to your leadership, you will be able to get your teams
to join and unite in strategic projects. 
An experience in the Home Improvement market is a prerequisite.

We are
looking for someone with the following qualities:
- strong interpersonal soft skills, able to interact with multiple
people and teams
- customer oriented, their experience is your priority
- confirmed management experience, supporting
your team is your priority
- strong business and strategic senses, supported by good analytical skills
- solution and
results oriented, caring, curious, agile and open minded
- speaking English

- Catalog strategy: identify the priorities for the company; you define and execute the cross team strategy (involving sourcing, logistics, product etc.)
- Catalog development: you identify opportunities to develop our catalog (at product, category or brand level); you generate leads to the sourcing teams and monitor their activation
- Catalog performance:Monitoring of key performance indicators, analysis of traffic, usage & purchasing behavior to improve performance. You report in the weekly business review the performance with a family prism and identify action plan to reach the targets
- You represent the International category management team and are the key contact for international teams (sourcing, communication, logistics…)

Merchandising
You have the responsibility to define and operate how we sell our products on the website and adapt the purchasing experience to the category and the customers expectations:
- Administrate the taxonomy, the filters (orders, values) and the features helping customers find their products on listings (guided navigation filters) and meeting local expectations
- Monitor and manage the implementation of key local projects

Promotion
You work closely with the promotion team to push and animate selections of our catalog with local specificities, in order to bring additional value to our visitors and generate additional turnover.

Required profile :

You already have several years of experience (min 5years) as a manager on similar commercial responsibilities. You know the retail, e-commerce or HI environment and you are at ease with project management.
You are curious, bold and looking for a new challenge, in a fast paced, international environment. You are solution and results oriented and you respond effectively to deadlines.
Thanks to your leadership, you will be able to get your teams to join and unite in strategic projects.
An experience in the digital world or/in the Home Improvement market is a plus.
We Are Looking For Someone With The Following Qualities:
- Strong interpersonal soft skills, able to interact with multiple people and teams
- Customer oriented, their experience is your priority
- Confirmed management experience, supporting your team is your priority
- Strong business and strategic senses, supported by good analytical skills
- Solution and results oriented
- Caring, curious, agile and open minded
- Speaking English

descriptionPlain:
Launched
in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United
Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities,
working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3
core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.


Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Product organization at ManoMano is divided into 6 Gears
(Mega-Tribe)
 
SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their business (main KPI: seller
revenues)
COMMERCE & CLIENTS: Help customer discover what they need (North Star Metric : add2cart rate)
PROJECTS &
SERVICES: Help the customer to set up his own project with advice. We will propose some new service dedicated to
DIY
OPERATIONS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring delivery and after sales experience (main KPI: NPS and
CSAT)
MONEY: Provide a secure & best-in class pay-in and pay-out experience (main KPI: Payment CVR & Compliance)
BTOB:
Transform the DIY marketplace to help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main KPI: B2B repurchase rate)


→ Currently, we have 1 open position in the Sellers tribe. The location is flexible, you can be based in France or
Spain.
 
Lead Product Management role at ManoMano

Within the Seller Insights and Services we are looking for a new
Lead Product Manager to join us in building a range of high Added Value services to stimulate further performance,
exposure for our partners & generate new revenue streams. 

The Seller Insights and services group is developing
expertise and solutions among 3 dimensions: Operational Services, Data Insights and Advertising solutions, for both
sellers and brands partnering with Manomano.

Our value proposition in Seller Insights and services is a key asset for
our partners, and we will invest massively in creating and or integrating further innovative solutions.

As a Train we
are setting our ambition as a collective effort with common goals, requiring Lead Product Manager to be a great leader
for its assigned Group, but also a great team player by supporting transversal projects that have direct impact on
Seller Experience. 

The scope of this role is very complete and allows to develop a managerial track, with high
visibility and complete autonomy on the scope. It requires a blend of technical & functional expertise, data fluency,
user understanding, and business acumen. The job will report to the Head of Product. 

Your main missions will consist
of:

1- Product discovery: Master the problem space of your group through a deep knowledge of your users pain points
and needs through qualitative research (assisted by our user research department) or quantitative data. Work closely
with the data science team to explore the next generation of merch and search optimizations. 

2- Product strategy:
Build and nurture the product vision with your stakeholders, based on the data you gathered (from users, your team, data
analysis, competitors, user research…)Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap: you will make sure that
we’re building the right features make sure your team / stakeholders understand and embrace it through your engaging
communication Integrate your group product strategy within the company strategy. Provide regular feedback and
communicate the vision to the leadership team. 

3 - Management: As a Lead Product Manager you are responsible for
coaching 2 to 3 individual PMs with various level of seniority and mastery of the role. You are responsible for
providing them with the correct environment for them to impact their KPIs and grow in their personal development.


Expected profile
- You have an engineering mindset & thrive in a startup environment growing (fast). 
- You have
already worked in an ecommerce company, started your own company or know at least the marketplace model.
- You have
already worked on Big data projects, or projects involving data science.
- You master the AB test techniques.
- You
handle ambiguity, complexity and interdependencies in an organized, prioritized and structured way. You have excellent
judgment and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem. You are passionate about it. 
- You have great
communication skills and intuition for communication strategy at every level.
- We often say about you that you’re an
analytical and “customer centric” person. You believe that data should help drive your product strategy.
- You are
kind, thoughtful and have a natural ability to get things done. You qualify as an “achiever” and a leader.
- You
understand perfectly the role of a product manager and you embrace the product methodology and culture. 
- Your English
is perfect.

Bonus points:
- You have experience with search engines, merchandizing and promotion mechanics and
tools.
- You love DIY and want to profoundly play a role in the reinvention of this market

Interview Process
1/
Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
2/ Zoom interview with the Product Director
3/ Zoom interview with the IT
Lead
4/ Zoom interview with the VP Product

Operating as a marketplace, ManoMano is continuously seeking for new value-added
services for its sellers. ManoMano is recruiting for a Lead, Advertising Account Management position. We believe that
advertising can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment for our advertising
partners. We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our talented team to help scale our early-stage
e-commerce monetization program. This role will manage a team of account managers who partner with our merchants, sales
and product to drive advertiser experience, revenue growth, and foster product improvements. 

As a Lead, Advertising
Account Management, you own the creation of the sales strategy and revenue forecasting for the business. You will
support and enable your team to meet and exceed goals set, act as a representative for merchants at the C-suite level
and collaborate with internal teams. You possess great communication skills along with analytical thinking, and will
develop deep expertise in our advertising products. You have experience in working within constantly evolving
environments.

We believe that advertising can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment for our advertising partners. We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our talented team to help scale our early-stage e-commerce monetization program. This role will manage a team of account managers who partner with our merchants, sales and product to drive advertiser experience, revenue growth, and foster product improvements. 

As a Lead, Advertising Account Management, you own the creation of the sales strategy and revenue forecasting for the business. You will support and enable your team to meet and exceed goals set, act as a representative for merchants at the C-suite level and collaborate with internal teams. lists.content:
• Lead a team of Account Managers to deliver a best in class merchant experience and growth their investment within advertising services
  • Drive overall advertising sales and account management strategy, execution, operations, and growth
  • Work closely with Sellers (including c-suite) to ensure they are seeing value in our advertising services
  • Own reporting and forecast of advertising revenue
  • Manage and create a high-performance team culture
  • Work cross-functionally with merchant sales and support them to deliver towards business goals

• Ability to work in English
  • Graduated from a Business School / Engineering School (or equivalent university education)
  • 5+ years of professional experience in digital advertising and client facing roles with a first experience managing a team
  • Consistent track record of driving a sales or account management team, both local and remote in an international environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to own business forecasting and reporting
  • Demonstrated high attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Have a competitive edge and thrive in a fast-paced team environment.
  • Fluent in French, German, Spanish, Italian or Chinese is a plus

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoMano has succeeded in creating outstanding business results and a strong and
vibrant culture over the last 7 years, and one of our main assets is the quality of our people processes. We launched in
2021 the implementation of an HRIS (SuccessFactors) as we are convinced that data quality and the simplicity of user
experience are key to leverage those People policies. 
This is the reason why we are looking for a HR Tooling Lead, who
will act as an enabler of this ambition. 
More specifically, you will : 

Define ManoMano's HR tooling strategy,
developing an overall vision of HR functional needs and proposing a relevant tooling architecture.
Provide support to
various HR stakeholders in charge of implementing new tools (recruitment, engagement…) to recommend a coherent
system
Implement and supervise ManoMano HRIS: 

Finalize the deployment of the ManoMano HRIS (SuccessFactors):
deployment of the 2022 modules: talent management, onboarding and compensation & benefits modules iLiaise with SAP
technical teams, the integrator and the internal IT team to build the interfaces between SuccessFactors and the
associated tools and information systems.

Recommend a change management strategy to engage employees and
managers
Provide training and support to HR users of the solution
Take charge of SuccessFactors corrective
maintenance, through simple system manipulations or the support of partners for more complex evolutions
Identify
SuccessFactors solution evolution needs
Take charge of payroll projects implementation in future MM subsidiaries + any
other module

Ensure the quality of reporting from the SuccessFactors solution
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoMano has succeeded in creating outstanding business results and a strong and vibrant culture over the last 7 years, and one of our main assets is the quality of our people processes. We launched in 2021 the implementation of an HRIS (SuccessFactors) as we are convinced that data quality and the simplicity of user experience are key to leverage those People policies.
This is the reason why we are looking for a HR Tooling Lead, who will act as an enabler of this ambition.
More specifically, you will : 

Define ManoMano's HR tooling strategy, developing an overall vision of HR functional needs and proposing a relevant tooling architecture.
Provide support to various HR stakeholders in charge of implementing new tools (recruitment, engagement…) to recommend a coherent system
Implement and supervise ManoMano HRIS: 

Finalize the deployment of the ManoMano HRIS (SuccessFactors): deployment of the 2022 modules: talent management, onboarding and compensation & benefits modules iLiaise with SAP technical teams, the integrator and the internal IT team to build the interfaces between SuccessFactors and the associated tools and information systems.

Recommend a change management strategy to engage employees and managers
Provide training and support to HR users of the solution
Take charge of SuccessFactors corrective maintenance, through simple system manipulations or the support of partners for more complex evolutions
Identify SuccessFactors solution evolution needs
Take charge of payroll projects implementation in future MM subsidiaries + any other module

Ensure the quality of reporting from the SuccessFactors solution

lists.content:
• 5+ years of experience with a strong focus on HR tooling - ideally with a mixed experience in consulting and within a company 
  • An experience with SuccessFactors
  • Ability to work with technical partners (IT, integrator)
  • Knowledge of HR topics on several streams (Payroll, Admin, Performance, Talent…)
  • A willingness to innovate and test new approaches in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent collaboration skills and a willingness to get involved in a strong human culture

Operating as a marketplace, ManoMano is continuously seeking for new value-added
services for its sellers. We believe that advertising can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return
on investment for our advertising partners. 

We are looking for a highly motivated Marketing Operations Assistant
(Apprentice) to join our talented team to help scale our early-stage Advertising for Partners team. Marketing Operations
Associate will partner with internal stakeholders to operationalise merchandising campaigns across the ManoMano
platforms, own key reporting, and foster product improvements. 

This role is crucial in developing our merchandising
efforts. If you love managing cross-functional stakeholders (across Sales, Marketing, Graphic Studio, Product), pushing

description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Operating as a marketplace, ManoMano is continuously seeking for new value-added services for its sellers. We believe that advertising can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment for our advertising partners.

We are looking for a highly motivated Marketing Operations Assistant (Apprentice) to join our talented team to help scale our early-stage Advertising for Partners team. Marketing Operations Associate will partner with internal stakeholders to operationalise merchandising campaigns across the ManoMano platforms, own key reporting, and foster product improvements.

This role is crucial in developing our merchandising efforts. If you love managing cross-functional stakeholders (across Sales, Marketing, Graphic Studio, Product), pushing projects forward to deliver measurable and meaningful results and finding ‘new ways of working’, then this position is for you!

lists.content:
• Own merchandising marketing operations for all countries :

  • Coordinate briefs: You’ll receive briefs and requirements from sales teams on how we will promote Brand messages via different channels (newsletters, affiliation, display, SEA, communication etc.). You will coordinate closely with these teams to ensure we are meeting best practices.

  • Build operations: Own the retroplanning, along with managing the brief for messaging and creative assets in order to implement onsite activations. You will also be responsible to ensure that operations are operating successfully throughout the length of the campaign.

  • Manage the marketing calendar: With the Sales and Promotions team, manage our marketing calendar in order to ensure great synergies between merchandising activations and commercial animations.

  •  Improve process continuously: With growth comes new needs and additional complexity, you’ll be in charge of improving processes continuously to make teams work together in the best possible way. This role will enable you to be hyper-focused on building the foundations of a highly efficient and strategic marketing process.

• Coming from a Business or Engineering school, you want to evolve in an e-commerce environment in a position which mixes marketing, analysis and commercial skills. 

  • You are passionate about e-commerce topics and want to revolutionize customer experience.

  • You are ingenious and enjoy testing and experimenting new ideas to find the best solution. 

  • You are known for your excellent rigor, analytical skills and you have developed strong interpersonal skills.

  • You are mastering Excel (Google Sheets) and ideally have notions of Google Analytics or web analytics tools. 

  • English language verbal and written is required.  Another ManoMano language spoken (French, Italian, Spanish or German) is a plus.

gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the
largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Within the Brand & Marcom and directly reporting to the Global Communications Lead
you will actively and enthusiastically drive PR campaigns and initiate strategic partnerships in order to drive
visibility, trust and traffic.

Your missions:

Lead, plan and conceive impactful PR campaigns and standout, ROI-led
partnerships in line with our brand image and business objectives on the French market.

Contribute to global PR &
partnerships strategies and support international coms managers in their local deployment.

Build top notch give & get
collaborations with partners to maximise visibility and impact.

Develop holistic deployment (crm, onsite, promo..) in
collaboration with internal teams, brand, studio, international marcom teams, digital marketing & product.

Ensure
smooth project management and anticipation of upcoming opportunities (always on the front foot).

Develop content
briefs and work with internal resources (writers, designers..) and external freelancers to produce high-quality content
for PR & partnership activations.

Measure and monitor our PR and partnerships impact, report back on results and make
recommendations for improvement.

Develop test & learn strategies: willing to take on feedback, from the team but also
from analytical tools, meaning priorities may vary depending on project results.

Foster innovation & provide
competitive insights with regards to Home Improvement & partnerships to upskill the team and ensure we are running best
practice campaigns with agility and creativity.

Be the steward of partnerships ensuring best ROI, scalability &
budget accuracy.

Profile requirement:

Bac +5 graduated from a Business School / Marketing & Communication
university degree
5+ years of experience in PR and partnerships
Good knowledge of the consumer media
landscape
Expertise in partnership strategies to build visibility, trust and traffic with scalability in mind
Sound
knowledge of marketing audiences, an experience in our industry is a plus Creativity to build partnerships that fit with
who we are as a brand
Strong sensibility to home improvement, home decor, and sustainability topics
Ability to think
analytically and creatively : bring creative ideas to the table to build our online presence as well as using analytics
tools to constantly feed and adapt our marcomms strategy
Sensibility to legal issues and ease exchanging with our legal
team for all things partnerships and PR stunt permissions
Can-do attitude, proactive with strong attention to detail
(we can’t miss any fine print with partnerships !)
Creative / Innovative / Out of the box thinker
Excellent written
and spoken English
Avid learner with a strong growth mindset and test & learn spirit
Ability to work in a constantly
changing environment
Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills

#Li-Remote #LI-Hybrid

At Manomano the payment team is part of the Finance & Legal team and includes three pillars: consumer payment, fraud prevention, seller finance. 

We are looking for a Payment Operations Analyst  with a passion for problem solving to join the Consumer Payment Team. You will help us improve our payment operational efficiency.
We are looking for a dynamic professional who likes operational challenges and is willing to be part of a company where everything is constantly moving.

lists.content:
• This position has two core focus : 

  • CUSTOMER CARE by providing timely and quality customer support whenever payment is our customer’s question. You’re partnering with our customer service team to ensure our customers are provided the best solution. Answers are provided by customer service in standard cases, and directly by the payment team in complex cases. 

  • SECURING PAYMENT OPERATIONS by a thorough best in class execution. Under the supervision of the payment manager, you will be in charge of the reconciliation of bank transfer payments, the processing of specific refunds and other recurring payment operations. We are working on the continuous improvement of our processes. As a payment operations analyst you are a critical contributor to identifying improvements and contribute to Manomano’s growth.

• This is a starting position for someone enthusiastic and who wants to discover e-commerce in a dynamic and fast-paced environement
  • You are able to demonstrate your precision and attention to detail in order to deliver a best in class execution of processes. Previous experience in financial processes is a plus (e-commerce payment team, cash management back office, PSP back office, etc)
  • You have great planning and organizational skills, empowering you to handle large volume of customer support request and payment operations
  • Proactive, critical mindset and fast-learning abilities
  • English and French are required

descriptionPlain:
Launched
in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United
Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities,
working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3
core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.


Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

The Product organization is divided into 4 Tribes:


SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their business (main KPI: seller revenues)
VISITORS:
Help customer discover what they need (main KPI: Add to cart rate)
BUYERS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring
buying experience (main KPI: NPS and Funnel Conversion Rate)
ACCELERATE: Transform the DIY marketplace to help
construction entrepreneur to run their business (main KPI: B2B repurchase rate)

We are looking for a Product Manager
for Mobile Apps in the Accelerate product Tribe. 
You will be in charge of the Mobile Apps Feature Team. 

Your main
missions will consist in 
1- Product discovery
- Understand your users pain points and needs through qualitative
research (assisted by our user research department) or quantitative data (NPS results, Customer Effort Score
verbatims)
- Analyse your product usage through our analytical tools stack (Amplitude, Metabase, SQL) to understand
what drives usage and conversion

2- Product strategy
- Build and nurture the product vision, based on the data you
gathered (from users, your team, data analysis, competitors, user research…)
- Turn that into a strategy and a
well-thought roadmap: you will make sure that we’re building the right features
- Make sure your team / stakeholders
understand and embrace it through your engaging communication 
- Integrate your group product strategy within the
company strategy

3- Product delivery
- Work closely with UX designers, User researcher, Engineers and data
scientists to come up with the best solution to address your users’ pain points: you will also make sure that we’re
building the feature right
- Turn your roadmap into a backlog of user stories. Organize and prioritize everything with
your Product Lead, and explain the rationale behind it to all partners, stakeholders and your team
- Ensure that all
products shipped by your team are bug-free (with the QA team’s help).
- Test hypothesis and ideas on the field with
ingenious MVPs
- Analyse features performance through A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate insights about your
product (with user researchers’ help)
- Communicate in a timely manner with your Product Lead about important
information, alerts, etc. Ask for help everytime you need it, and be a fast learner


Expected profile
- Experience
of product ownership in an agile development environment with a proven track record of successful product delivery.
-
You handle ambiguity, complexity and interdependencies in an organized, prioritized and structured way. 
- You have
excellent judgment and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem. 
- You have great communication skills
and intuition for communication strategy at every level.
- If you have already worked on a mobile consumer application
and know the challenges of this type of product is a plus. 
- If you have an expertise in iOS and Android mobile
platforms/stores, it is a plus. 
-Good knowledge of the world of mobile: acquisition techniques, ASO, analytics
(Firebase, GTM), and also of m-crm,is a plus.
- We often say about you that you’re an analytical and “customer centric”
person.
- You believe that data should help drive your product strategy.
- You are kind, thoughtful and have a natural
ability to get things done. You qualify as an “achiever”.
- Your English is perfect and you speak French!
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

The Product organization is divided into 4 Tribes: 

SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their business (main KPI: seller revenues)
VISITORS: Help customer discover what they need (main KPI: Add to cart rate)
BUYERS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring buying experience (main KPI: NPS and Funnel Conversion Rate)
ACCELERATE: Transform the DIY marketplace to help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main KPI: B2B repurchase rate)

We are looking for a Product Manager for Mobile Apps in the Accelerate product Tribe.
You will be in charge of the Mobile Apps Feature Team.

Your main missions will consist in 
1- Product discovery
- Understand your users pain points and needs through qualitative research (assisted by our user research department) or quantitative data (NPS results, Customer Effort Score verbatims)
- Analyse your product usage through our analytical tools stack (Amplitude, Metabase, SQL) to understand what drives usage and conversion

2- Product strategy
- Build and nurture the product vision, based on the data you gathered (from users, your team, data analysis, competitors, user research…)
- Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap: you will make sure that we’re building the right features
- Make sure your team / stakeholders understand and embrace it through your engaging communication 
- Integrate your group product strategy within the company strategy

3- Product delivery
- Work closely with UX designers, User researcher, Engineers and data scientists to come up with the best solution to address your users’ pain points: you will also make sure that we’re building the feature right
- Turn your roadmap into a backlog of user stories. Organize and prioritize everything with your Product Lead, and explain the rationale behind it to all partners, stakeholders and your team
- Ensure that all products shipped by your team are bug-free (with the QA team’s help).
- Test hypothesis and ideas on the field with ingenious MVPs
- Analyse features performance through A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate insights about your product (with user researchers’ help)
- Communicate in a timely manner with your Product Lead about important information, alerts, etc. Ask for help everytime you need it, and be a fast learner


Expected profile
- Experience of product ownership in an agile development environment with a proven track record of successful product delivery.
- You handle ambiguity, complexity and interdependencies in an organized, prioritized and structured way.
- You have excellent judgment and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem. 
- You have great communication skills and intuition for communication strategy at every level.
- If you have already worked on a mobile consumer application and know the challenges of this type of product is a plus. 
- If you have an expertise in iOS and Android mobile platforms/stores, it is a plus.  
-Good knowledge of the world of mobile: acquisition techniques, ASO, analytics (Firebase, GTM), and also of m-crm,is a plus.
- We often say about you that you’re an analytical and “customer centric” person.
- You believe that data should help drive your product strategy.
- You are kind, thoughtful and have a natural ability to get things done. You qualify as an “achiever”.
- Your English is perfect and you speak French!

descriptionPlain:
Launched
in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United
Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities,
working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3
core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.


Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Product organization at ManoMano is divided into 5 Gears
(Mega-Tribe)
SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their business (main KPI: seller
revenues)
COMMERCE: Help customer discover what they need (Main KPI : add to cart rate)
PROJECT & SERVICES: Help the
customer to set up his own project with advice. We will propose some new services dedicated to DIY 
BUYERS: Offer the
most seamless and reassuring buying (main KPI: NPS and Funnel Conversion Rate)
BtoB: Transform the DIY marketplace to
help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main KPI: B2B repurchase rate)

Each tribe includes several
Feature Teams (FTs) gathered within Groups (small entities of up to 4 FTs).

→ The open position of Product Manager -
Payment Methods is in the Buyers tribe.

Your Product Management role at ManoMano
As Product Manager for Payment
Methods, you will be responsible for integrating the different payment methods for our customers in France, Italy,
Spain, Germany, the United Kingdom, and Belgium. Your role will be to understand customer preferences, the technical
requirements to integrate a payment method, and follow up closely the performance of each payment option available
(conversion rate, decline rate, fraud rate, cost). You will also provide recommendations to optimize each one of the
metrics for our payment offers. This job is also an opportunity to understand our customers and create adapted journeys
to the type of customer (B2B, B2C), their kind of purchase (single, recurring purchase, financing), and align them to
our business objectives.

The role reports to the Head of Product Payments and Finance. Your future manager has more
than 15 years of experience in e-commerce and Payments and will coach you in your journey to become a great Product
Manager. Additionally, your future manager is passionate about diversity and inclusion and appreciates people from
different backgrounds and cultures.

Your main missions will consist in 

1- Product discovery
Master the problem
space of your feature team through a deep knowledge of the buyer's pain points and needs through qualitative research
(assisted by our user research department), quantitative data (NPS results, Customer Effort Score verbatims), or
understanding regulatory frameworks (in partnership with our Legal, Compliance and Finance teams). 

2- Product
strategy
- Build and nurture the product vision based on the data you gathered (from users, your team, data analysis,
competitors, user research, regulatory frameworks…)
- Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap: you will
make sure that we're building the right features at the right time. 
- Make sure your team and stakeholders understand
and embrace it through your engaging communication 
- With the guidance of your manager, integrate your product
strategy within the company strategy

3- Product delivery
- Ensure the correct delivery of your feature team; you
collaborate with them daily to build a great product. Animate demos of your team to foster a continuous improvement
culture
- Be obsessed by the impact of the features you ship through A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate
insights about your product (with user researchers' help)
- Communicate promptly with your Head of Product about
important information, alerts, etc. Ask for help every time you need it and be a fast learner
- You and your feature
team will work very closely with the team in charge of the Payments Platform. Your scope will be closer to the customers
when they pay in our checkout while the platform takes care of the rest, what happens in the back. 

Expected
profile
- You understand and know the preferred payment methods in France, the UK, Germany, Italy, Spain, and Belgium
and, most importantly, the reasons for such preference.
- You know the impact of the following regulations on a
business's payments strategy: Second Payment Services Directive, Strong Customer Authentication, 3D Secure V2, Payment
Card Industry Data Security Standard. 
- You have excellent communication skills and intuition to adapt your message
according to your audience. 
- You have an engineering mindset or an Engineering degree. If you have a Business School
degree or any other kind of education, you are comfortable working and communicating with Engineers, and you are willing
to learn more. 
- You are comfortable with a fast-growing scaleup, which means you can adapt quickly, see the big
picture, pay attention to details, and you can find ingenious ways to maximize resources. 
- You have developed empathy
to understand customers and ask the right questions to discover the underlying problem.
- You are comfortable handling
data (in Excel, SQL, or something more advanced, the choice is yours, but you know how to get insights independently).
You believe that data should help drive your product strategy. You can prove your hypothesis through data points. 
-
You can synthesize data and communicate the most critical insights. 
- You are kind, thoughtful and have developed an
ability to get things done.
- Your English CEFR level is at least B1

Bonus points:
- You can clearly explain the
acquirer, issuer, network, merchant, and customer model for processing payments to a non-technical person.
- You have
worked on a Payments company, either a fintech, a PSP, a card network, or a bank in their online payments team
(e-commerce). Alternatively, you have worked on the Payments team of a Marketplace.
- You know how to use Amplitude to
create funnels to track conversion rates and get insights to improve your product. 
- You have been a Product Manager
for more than two years. Else, if you are looking to become one, we can teach you! But you need to prove you understand
the Product Management role, are passionate about it, and are convinced it is the right move for your professional
development.
- You enjoy DIY, gardening, or home improvement and want to play a role in the reinvention of this market
profoundly.

It is OK to apply without meeting all the requirements; tell us why you are the right candidate, your
motivation, and what you would need to be successful. 

Interview Process
1/ Phone interview with a Talent
Recruiter
2/ Interview with the Head of Product (the hiring manager)
3/ Interview with the Engineering Lead
4/
Interview with the Head of Payments (stakeholder)

Apprentice, Intern or Stagiare for Payments, you will learn from and support Veronika, the Product Manager for the
Payments Platform at ManoMano. You will have the opportunity to experience first hand the action of processing more than
1,2B€ (yes, that’s billions of euros and it was our 2020 volume).


Your main missions:
You will participate in the
various phases of the Payments Platform product life cycle. Veronika, the Product Manager, will be your mentor and you
will support her to achieve the goals of her feature team working hand in hand with Engineering, Business Stakeholders,
Design, Quality and the rest of the Product Team. 
If you want to learn about FinTech, Payments and Product Management
in a unicorn and scaleup, this will be the right internship for you.

1. Product discovery:
Discover, analyze and
understand our customers pain points and unmet needs, thanks to different tools and methodologies and working with User
Research or Country Managers. 
2. Product testing & delivery:
Translate requirements and needs into well-defined user
stories, product specifications or bug tickets. You will learn and participate in the agile rituals of the team plus the
Agile at scale framework of ManoMano. 
3. Product Data:
Understand user behavior by looking at different sources of
data, notably Amplitude, Google Analytics, Datadog or Stripe
4. Product Communication:
You will learn how to
effectively communicate complex technical concepts to your stakeholders and also how to communicate with Engineering
Teams efficiently.


Expected profile :

Education: You are a student. We embrace diversity and inclusion so we are
open to any career you have chosen. 
Communication: You can communicate effectively in English and French. You can
listen and synthesize efficiently. 
Curious: Even if you do not really know what happens when you enter your card
number online, you are curious about FinTech in general and would like to learn more about it.
Analytical mindset: You
are comfortable analyzing data in Google sheets and you master pivot tables.
Product savvy: You are capable of
explaining the key feature that a financial app is missing and most importantly, why it would make a difference. 
Soft
skills: You have developed empathy, you are kind, thoughtful and diligent.

Bonus points:
Payments: You have
experience in a payments company or you have integrated a payment processor in a website.
Communication: You have a
blog or you have written articles in a blogging platform or you actively communicate in your Twitter
account.
E-commerce: You have already worked in an e-commerce company or Marketplace.
DIY: You enjoy DIY, gardening or
home improvement and want to profoundly play a role in the reinvention of this market.

It is OK to apply without
meeting all the requirements, just tell us why you are the right candidate, what is your motivation and what would you
need to be successful.


Interview Process

1/ Product Management Survey - An online questionnaire to learn more
about you, your motivations and your written skills.
2/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
3/ Video interview
with Veronika, Product Manager Payments and hiring manager
4/ Video interview with Sergio, Head of Product Payments and
Finance
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Context:

Product organization at ManoMano is divided into 5 Gears (Mega-Teams)
SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their business (main KPI: seller revenues)
COMMERCE: Help customer discover what they need (Main KPI : add to cart rate)
PROJECT & SERVICES: Help the customer to set up his own project with advice. We will propose some new services dedicated to DIY 
BUYERS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring buying (main KPI: NPS and Funnel Conversion Rate)
BtoB: Transform the DIY marketplace to help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main KPI: B2B repurchase rate)
→ The open position of Intern Product Manager Payments in the Buyers team.


Your Product Management role at ManoMano
As Product Manager Apprentice, Intern or Stagiare for Payments, you will learn from and support Veronika, the Product Manager for the Payments Platform at ManoMano. You will have the opportunity to experience first hand the action of processing more than 1,2B€ (yes, that’s billions of euros and it was our 2020 volume).


Your main missions:
You will participate in the various phases of the Payments Platform product life cycle. Veronika, the Product Manager, will be your mentor and you will support her to achieve the goals of her feature team working hand in hand with Engineering, Business Stakeholders, Design, Quality and the rest of the Product Team. 
If you want to learn about FinTech, Payments and Product Management in a unicorn and scaleup, this will be the right internship for you.

1. Product discovery:
Discover, analyze and understand our customers pain points and unmet needs, thanks to different tools and methodologies and working with User Research or Country Managers. 
2. Product testing & delivery:
Translate requirements and needs into well-defined user stories, product specifications or bug tickets. You will learn and participate in the agile rituals of the team plus the Agile at scale framework of ManoMano. 
3. Product Data:
Understand user behavior by looking at different sources of data, notably Amplitude, Google Analytics, Datadog or Stripe
4. Product Communication:
You will learn how to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to your stakeholders and also how to communicate with Engineering Teams efficiently.


Expected profile :

Education: You are a student. We embrace diversity and inclusion so we are open to any career you have chosen. 
Communication: You can communicate effectively in English and French. You can listen and synthesize efficiently. 
Curious: Even if you do not really know what happens when you enter your card number online, you are curious about FinTech in general and would like to learn more about it.
Analytical mindset: You are comfortable analyzing data in Google sheets and you master pivot tables.
Product savvy: You are capable of explaining the key feature that a financial app is missing and most importantly, why it would make a difference. 
Soft skills: You have developed empathy, you are kind, thoughtful and diligent.

Bonus points:
Payments: You have experience in a payments company or you have integrated a payment processor in a website.
Communication: You have a blog or you have written articles in a blogging platform or you actively communicate in your Twitter account.
E-commerce: You have already worked in an e-commerce company or Marketplace.
DIY: You enjoy DIY, gardening or home improvement and want to profoundly play a role in the reinvention of this market.

It is OK to apply without meeting all the requirements, just tell us why you are the right candidate, what is your motivation and what would you need to be successful.


Interview Process

1/ Product Management Survey - An online questionnaire to learn more about you, your motivations and your written skills.
2/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
3/ Video interview with Veronika, Product Manager Payments and hiring manager
4/ Video interview with Sergio, Head of Product Payments and Finance

Within the FR Seller’s Partnership team and reporting to
the FR Sourcing Promotion Manager, you will be at the heart of the coordination and the execution of the commercial
operations in France. As a Promotion Project Coordinator, you will work hand in hand with the Account Managers to
implement ManoMano’s key promotional events. You will also be key to automate and scale the current processes in order
to improve the efficiency of the way we operate these campaigns. This is a great opportunity if you wish to start with

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.

Within the FR Seller’s Partnership team and reporting to the FR Sourcing Promotion Manager, you will be at the heart of the coordination and the execution of the commercial operations in France. As a Promotion Project Coordinator, you will work hand in hand with the Account Managers to implement ManoMano’s key promotional events. You will also be key to automate and scale the current processes in order to improve the efficiency of the way we operate these campaigns. This is a great opportunity if you wish to start with an experience at the core of ManoMano’s growth and manage a cross-functional project collaborating closely with ManoMano’s Business, Marketing and Sales Operations teams.

lists.content:
• Create, implement and monitor ManoMano FR’s promotional operations,

  • Participate in the Proposal Building: Determine categories, brands and products to promote based on the analysis of key metrics and trends. Work with internal teams to ensure the success of the operation (Marketing, Acquisition and Communication),

  • Implement Operations: Coordinate the retroplanning, create the brief for the creative assets in collaboration with the Marketing team and communicate with our partners to ensure these assets fit their expectations and campaign objectives,

  • Monitor Results: Conduct in-depth analysis to identify growth opportunities & monitor results of  the operation’s KPIs and propose an action plan accordingly,

  • Meet the Deadline: Make sure all stakeholders deliver on time for the campaign launch,

  • Improve Processes: with accelerated growth comes  additional complexity and a need to adapt and review processes, you will be in charge of improving processes continuously to make teams work together in the best possible way,

  • Provide Recommendations: Provide meaningful insights and bring actionable recommendations for next operations to continuously increase performance.

• Last year of Master’s degree from a business/engineering school (or equivalent university education),

  • Data driven with good analytical skills,

  • Excellent digital culture,

  • Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment),

  • Curious, with a strong desire to learn,

  • Able to lead and carry ambitious projects,

  • Languages: Native French and fluency in English,

  • Advanced knowledge of Excel,

  •  Previous internship experience in ecommerce and/or the retail industry is a strong plus.

• Duration: 6 months

  • Start: January 2022

  • Interview process :

    • Interview with Account Manager
    Interview with Lead Account Manager
    Interview with talent Recruiter

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader
specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening
online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer
across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos,
including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and
Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and
care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to
put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

To consolidate its position as DIY and Gardening online leader, ManoMano has put
technology at the heart of its strategy. We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering high quality products that we will
be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionize their online DIY experience.

For
your part, you know that Quality is not about bringing in an army of Testers at the very end of the SDLC, this is
old-school !
On the contrary, you have the absolute conviction that Quality must be taken into account and challenged
from the expression of need, throughout the SDLC, as well as after deployment in production. 
You are driven by this
mindset of continuous improvement and you love advocating for quality and testing practices in a full Agile
context.

At ManoMano, your mission will be composed of three main streams :
1- Spread The Quality Culture: Empower
the team to be the owners of the quality of their product
2- Enable Continuous Improvement: Challenge teams on their
processes and encourage them to take actions for improvement
3- Mentoring Feature Teams on testing practices: Challenge
their work, being a facilitator and a coach to help team members learn more and progress at their best

Our current
tech stack :
- Microservice architecture in the cloud with AWS, Kubernetes (check our blog)
- JavaScript (NextJS,
React Native), Java, Kotlin, Golang
- Jira and Xray for test scenario management
- CodeceptJS, Detox, Webdriver for
GUI testing
- Postman, Newman and CodeceptJS, Behat, PACT for API testing
- Gitlab / Bitrise / Bitbar for our CI/CD/CT
together with Sonarqube for Code quality
- And more... including an in-house defect management system!


ABOUT
YOU

Technical skills :

- Relevant experience in QA roles working as part of a wider development team, pairing with
Devs, Product Manager, SRE, Designers and other relevant stakeholders
- Solid understanding of the SDLC and Agile
methodologies
- Embracing the devops mindset, shifting the testing effort to the left and other relevant modern
techniques, while having experience applying them in real projects
- Understanding the practical Test Pyramid, applying
the right testing techniques at the right time
- Experience with Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) concept
-
Understanding of Microservice Architecture
- Knowledge in Restful API
- Working experience with CI/CD, Test Management
Tools

Interpersonal Skills :

- You are a good communicator : We want to spread the quality mindset across the
Teams
- Ingenious, creative, humble and curious with a big appetite to learn, discover and experiment new things: We
always question the status quo
- Autonomous and adaptable: You know what working in a fast-changing environment
means
- You are a good team player: One player wins matches, the team wins trophies
- You have a problem solver
mindset: We face new challenges every day
- You are comfortable communicating in English: We have a lot of
nationalities, so it’s our company's official language

Bonus points

- Experience with a Software Programming
Language (JavaScript Preferred) as a developer or as a test automation engineer
- Previous experience working in a
marketplace
- You keep up-to-date with the QA industry’s best practices, tools and techniques

INTERVIEW PROCESS
:

1/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter 
+ Technical Test 
2/ Zoom interview with a Team Lead + Software
Engineer
3/ Final Zoom interview with an Engineering Manager 

#LI-Remote

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

To consolidate its position as DIY and Gardening online leader, ManoMano has put technology at the heart of its strategy. We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering high quality products that we will be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionize their online DIY experience.

For your part, you know that Quality is not about bringing in an army of Testers at the very end of the SDLC, this is old-school !
On the contrary, you have the absolute conviction that Quality must be taken into account and challenged from the expression of need, throughout the SDLC, as well as after deployment in production. 
You are driven by this mindset of continuous improvement and you love advocating for quality and testing practices in a full Agile context.

At ManoMano, your mission will be composed of three main streams :
1- Spread The Quality Culture: Empower the team to be the owners of the quality of their product
2- Enable Continuous Improvement: Challenge teams on their processes and encourage them to take actions for improvement
3- Mentoring Feature Teams on testing practices: Challenge their work, being a facilitator and a coach to help team members learn more and progress at their best

- Postman, Newman and CodeceptJS, Behat, PACT for API testing

- Solid understanding of the SDLC and Agile methodologies
- Embracing the devops mindset, shifting the testing effort to the left and other relevant modern techniques, while having experience applying them in real projects
- Understanding the practical Test Pyramid, applying the right testing techniques at the right time
- Experience with Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) concept
- Understanding of Microservice Architecture
- Knowledge in Restful API
- Working experience with CI/CD, Test Management Tools

Interpersonal Skills :

- You are a good communicator : We want to spread the quality mindset across the Teams
- Ingenious, creative, humble and curious with a big appetite to learn, discover and experiment new things: We always question the status quo
- Autonomous and adaptable: You know what working in a fast-changing environment means
- You are a good team player: One player wins matches, the team wins trophies
- You have a problem solver mindset: We face new challenges every day
- You are comfortable communicating in English: We have a lot of nationalities, so it’s our company's official language

Bonus points

- Experience with a Software Programming Language (JavaScript Preferred) as a developer or as a test automation engineer
- Previous experience working in a marketplace
- You keep up-to-date with the QA industry’s best practices, tools and techniques

INTERVIEW PROCESS :

1/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
+ Technical Test
2/ Zoom interview with a Team Lead + Software Engineer
3/ Final Zoom interview with an Engineering Manager

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Operations Analyst to join our talented Sales Operations Team to help us grow and bring actionable recommendations based on data.

By joining our team, your main contribution will be to set up processes into CRM tools (Zoho Suite) to improve the efficiency of all programs of different business strategic scopes : Seller Partnership, Mano Fulfillment, Mano Expansion, Seller New Services, and build the reports to monitor the performance. 

Also, if you love working with cross-functional stakeholders (finance, data, tech, sales, logistics, marketing, etc..) you will support the team by leading end-to-end projects. 

As part of an international group, you'll enjoy working with different nationalities and understand the specificities of each group.

lists.content:
• Build new automations and features as CRM project manager to improve seller onboarding process into Zoho CRM
  • Set up an overall seller communication process in ManoMano and implement KPIs to better understand impacts of communications 
  • Create new reports & dashboards with tools like Zoho CRM, Qlik, Metabase to analyse sales/sellers performances
  • Maintain, execute & optimize  existing Sales Operations operational tasks & reporting routines
  • Understand & explain business performances by using data, developing adequate reporting and automated user insights dashboard.
  • Plan Quarterly process post-mortems and help identify areas for improvements

• Bac +4/+5 graduated from a Top Business/Engineering School (or equivalent university education)
  • Autonomous, proactive, detail-oriented and hands-on
  • The ability to synthesize and explain your analyses

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in
DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Our team : The B2B sales team mission is to provide support both technical and
digital to make sure our pro clients buy easily on our platform and develop a repeat purchase habit. The B2B sales team
is composed of country sales managers (1 for France, 1 for Southern Europe) and their agents (~30) and a transversal
support team monitor and challenge our sales performance, build our lead generation, set up quality processes and create
trainings for our teams.

Your mission? You will be the reference on the tools daily used by the sales team (CRM,
phone tool, mailing tool) and propose improvements in order to drive our performance and level of service. You will be
reporting to the Quality & Process manager and you will work closely with the B2B performance manager and the sales
managers of France & Southern Europe.You will be based in the ManoMano Paris office, République.

• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere

  • Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills
