descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Background & Missions

ManoMano, already positioned as the European leader in DIY,
wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. For this, ManoMano is extending an amazing security team,
and is looking for a Platform Security Engineer.

You will work to enforce and improve the security level of the
platform. You will be working on the Cloud Security part and you will be collaborating with the rest of the team to
participate in red teams, audits, pentests and many other hacker activities. 

The candidate must have a strong desire
to learn, progress and innovate on intrusion techniques and offensive security. Our goal within the security team is to
maintain a state-of-the-art security level and more again with innovation and creativity.

Your missions

-Provide
the Platform team with the tools and dashboard so they can have the right security vision. Implement and tune platform
security tools with amazing SRE user experience.

- DevSecOps & Culture, implementation of CI/CD deployment of the
security platform and evolution. Develop and maintain a strong DevSecOps culture.

- Lead and support application
security reviews and threat modeling including code review, static code analysis and dynamic testing (terraform, helm,
...).

- Automate and integrate security processes and controls throughout our entire SDLC from IDEs to source control
systems to CI/CD pipelines to production deployments.

- Collaborate with DevOps, Software Engineering, and Product
Management to continuously improve our application security strategies and priorities for protecting our customers,
sellers and company.

- Report and communicate security issues and topics to technical and non-technical audiences.
You will animate conferences and workshops.

- Consider emerging vulnerabilities and threats from within the context
of organizational risk and business impact(s).

- Maintain a strong security culture: We create awareness and training
programs. You maintain a high security culture in the company. Participate in the organization of theSthack.fr.

-
Evangelizing security with our engineers. To be a key contact within the technical teams.

- Involve in design
solutions and fixing vulnerabilities. As a role of security referent, you would support operational and project teams in
daily tasks and issues.

- Be the first response and remediation for security-related alerts/incidents.
 Develop an
active defense: We develop and integrate security tools/solutions to automate and improve detection and
remediation.

Your profile

- Mastering Cloud Public and Cloud Security.Knowledge Network & infrastructure.
-
Experience using container and container orchestration technology (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Experience with CI/CD
tools.
- Knowledge TOP 10 OWASP.
- Mastering Infra as Code.
- Experience with scripting languages
- Experience with
Infrastructure Pentest and Audit.
- Threat intelligence.
- Excellent ability to communicate (oral and writing) to
technical and non-technical audiences with a positive and collaborative attitude.
- Language: French, English
-
Diploma: curiosity learner +++ 

What we offer at ManoMano

- Fast growing start-up environment
- international
(20+ nationalties) & agile company
- Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external
Meetups
- Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledges, learn from others)
- Swile card for lunch
-
60% company medical insurance
- 7 weeks of payed vacation
- Choose your days of remote work per week
- Parenthood
-
Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Bordeaux & Barcelona
- Attractive salary (package)
- Mac, PC or Linux: it’s up
to you!

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Background & Missions

ManoMano, already positioned as the European leader in DIY, wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. For this, ManoMano is extending an amazing security team, and is looking for a Platform Security Engineer.

You will work to enforce and improve the security level of the platform. You will be working on the Cloud Security part and you will be collaborating with the rest of the team to participate in red teams, audits, pentests and many other hacker activities. 

The candidate must have a strong desire to learn, progress and innovate on intrusion techniques and offensive security. Our goal within the security team is to maintain a state-of-the-art security level and more again with innovation and creativity.

Your missions

-Provide the Platform team with the tools and dashboard so they can have the right security vision. Implement and tune platform security tools with amazing SRE user experience.

- DevSecOps & Culture, implementation of CI/CD deployment of the security platform and evolution. Develop and maintain a strong DevSecOps culture.

- Lead and support application security reviews and threat modeling including code review, static code analysis and dynamic testing (terraform, helm, ...).

- Automate and integrate security processes and controls throughout our entire SDLC from IDEs to source control systems to CI/CD pipelines to production deployments.

- Collaborate with DevOps, Software Engineering, and Product Management to continuously improve our application security strategies and priorities for protecting our customers, sellers and company.

- Report and communicate security issues and topics to technical and non-technical audiences. You will animate conferences and workshops.

- Consider emerging vulnerabilities and threats from within the context of organizational risk and business impact(s).

- Maintain a strong security culture: We create awareness and training programs. You maintain a high security culture in the company. Participate in the organization of theSthack.fr.

- Evangelizing security with our engineers. To be a key contact within the technical teams.

- Involve in design solutions and fixing vulnerabilities. As a role of security referent, you would support operational and project teams in daily tasks and issues.

- Be the first response and remediation for security-related alerts/incidents.
 Develop an active defense: We develop and integrate security tools/solutions to automate and improve detection and remediation.

Your profile

- Mastering Cloud Public and Cloud Security.Knowledge Network & infrastructure.
- Experience using container and container orchestration technology (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Experience with CI/CD tools.
- Knowledge TOP 10 OWASP.
- Mastering Infra as Code.
- Experience with scripting languages
- Experience with Infrastructure Pentest and Audit.
- Threat intelligence.
- Excellent ability to communicate (oral and writing) to technical and non-technical audiences with a positive and collaborative attitude.
- Language: French, English
- Diploma: curiosity learner +++ 

What we offer at ManoMano

- Fast growing start-up environment
- international (20+ nationalties) & agile company
- Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
- Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledges, learn from others)
- Swile card for lunch
- 60% company medical insurance
- 7 weeks of payed vacation
- Choose your days of remote work per week
- Parenthood
- Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Bordeaux & Barcelona
- Attractive salary (package)
- Mac, PC or Linux: it’s up to you!

As a Seller Account Manager, you will be responsible for the top and bottom-line results of your portfolio.

lists.content:
• Management of a SMB sellers portfolio identifying sales opportunities to make grow the overall business
  • Advise and continuously negotiate on selection, pricing competitiveness, and stock management
  • Identify and provide advice on how to improve any business input that drives growth and improve end customer experience
  • Create a scaled commercial relationship within your portfolio
  • Follow closely the performances indicators to optimize the sales growth
  • Build long term relationships with sellers across your portfolio
  • Act as an advisor to improve your portfolio performance
  • Engage sellers and frequently share valuable insights with them
  • Continuously negotiate better partnership terms for ManoMano
  • Act as a point of escalation for seller issues, questions, or concerns

• 1+ years of experience working in sales account management, buying, consulting, or marketing/merchandising
  • Experience in managing  and scaling a large portfolio of sellers it’s a big plus
  • Strong understanding of e-commerce and the retail industry.
  • DIY industry knowledge is a big plus
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with senior business leaders
  • Data-driven with strong analytical skills
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel.
  • SQL is a strong plus
  • Autonomous and adaptable, able to work in a constantly changing environment
  • Native in Italian and fluent in English both written and spoken

• Fast-growing start-up environmentInternational & agile company 
  • Possible full remote
  • Sponsoring to external conferences - organization of internal and external Meetups
  • DIY workshops and internal events
  • An amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Barcelona & Bordeaux

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013,
ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the
largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano
brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We
currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4
offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and
(hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look
at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As the Manager of Seller Finance you are part of the Payment & Fraud
prevention team. The payment team includes three pillars: seller finance, payment, fraud prevention. You will lead the
seller finance scope. Manomano gathers a qualitative and selective network of over 3500 sellers. You play a key role to
offer them an optimized payment experience, while protecting Manomano’s assets. 

You are in charge of strategy,
projects and operations on the following scope :

Pay-out to over 3500 sellers, dealing with the complexity of an
online marketplace collecting sales on behalf of sellers from diversified countries, in several currencies, and
invoicing an increasing panel of services. This is an integrated end to end payment flow from buyers to sellers,
enriched from additional services

Minimizing seller risk while keeping seller friction at a minimum level. At this
point this mainly covers credit risk, developing risk models to define dynamic payout rules.

Recovery of seller
debt

Supporting the development of financial services to our sellers, by Manomano or via partnerships (Fx, working
capital, financing, …)

Supporting sellers on any finance / payout related topics (questions, claims, request of new
features) and hence becoming the go-to person for our sellers finance directors and finance teams

To do so your main
missions are :

You identify and manage projects improving Manomano’s seller finance solutions and processes
Manomano
is strongly investing in your scope, both on the backbone of the payment solution and on the development of new
features. To drive these changes, you can rely on a dedicated “feature team” including developers and a great product
manager. 
You are responsible for the continuous improvement of seller finance processes, aiming at better seller
experience, operational efficiency & costs.
You are in charge of maintaining a quality relationship with our sellers on
all financial topics. 
You are the owner of seller finance KPIs and are responsible for seller finance operations
(pay-out, seller risk, recovery of seller debt, seller support)
You are responsible of ensuring compliance to key
regulations on your scope
You will manage our seller finance specialist.

Pay-out to over 3500 sellers, dealing with the complexity of an online marketplace collecting sales on behalf of sellers from diversified countries, in several currencies, and invoicing an increasing panel of services. This is an integrated end to end payment flow from buyers to sellers, enriched from additional services

Minimizing seller risk while keeping seller friction at a minimum level. At this point this mainly covers credit risk, developing risk models to define dynamic payout rules.

Recovery of seller debt

Supporting the development of financial services to our sellers, by Manomano or via partnerships (Fx, working capital, financing, …)

Supporting sellers on any finance / payout related topics (questions, claims, request of new features) and hence becoming the go-to person for our sellers finance directors and finance teams

lists.content:
• As the Manager of Seller Finance you are part of the Payment & Fraud prevention team. The payment team includes three pillars: seller finance, payment, fraud prevention. You will lead the seller finance scope. Manomano gathers a qualitative and selective network of over 3500 sellers. You play a key role to offer them an optimized payment experience, while protecting Manomano’s assets. 

  • You are in charge of strategy, projects and operations on the following scope:

  • Pay-out to over 3500 sellers, dealing with the complexity of an online marketplace collecting sales on behalf of sellers from diversified countries, in several currencies, and invoicing an increasing panel of services. This is an integrated end to end payment flow from buyers to sellers, enriched from additional services

  • Minimizing seller risk while keeping seller friction at a minimum level. At this point this mainly covers credit risk, developing risk models to define dynamic payout rules.

  • Recovery of seller debt

  • Supporting the development of financial services to our sellers, by Manomano or via partnerships (Fx, working capital, financing, …)

  • Supporting sellers on any finance / payout related topics (questions, claims, request of new features) and hence becoming the go-to person for our sellers finance directors and finance teams

  • To do so your main missions are :

  • You identify and manage projects improving Manomano’s seller finance solutions and processes. Manomano is strongly investing in your scope, both on the backbone of the payment solution and on the development of new features. To drive these changes, you can rely on a dedicated “feature team” including developers and a great product manager. 
  • You are responsible for the continuous improvement of seller finance processes, aiming at better seller experience, operational efficiency & costs.
  • You are in charge of maintaining a quality relationship with our sellers on all financial topics. 
  • You are the owner of seller finance KPIs and are responsible for seller finance operations (pay-out, seller risk, recovery of seller debt, seller support)You are responsible of ensuring compliance to key regulations on your scope
  • You will manage a team of two people, and work in close collaboration with 2 dedicated features teams

• You hold a Masters degree and have at least 5 years experience gained in either e-commerce, a payment provider or consulting (strategy, transaction services)
  • You ideally have a previous experience on a similar scope for an online marketplace 
  • You have a strong financial background allowing you to meet the expectations from our sellers’ finance team
  • You are data driven, have strong analytical and quantitative skills and take your decisions based on relevant KPIs
  • You have experience managing a transverse scope, aligning multiple internal and external stakeholders (sellers, providers) and product teams
  • You are enthusiastic about bringing Manomano’s seller finance to the next level, driven by a culture of action and excellence
  • You are fluent in English and French. Other language much appreciated (German, Spanish, Italian, Mandarin)

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As part of the Seller Support Team, and working directly for Lead Seller Support,
you will play a key role in the long term improvement of the Seller Experience, working within an essential service to
ensure the growth of ManoMano. You will demonstrate end to end ownership of every seller interaction coupled with
proactive problem solving.

Responsibilities include: (i) supporting international Sellers during the technical
onboarding, (ii)bringing them day to day technical and operational support, (iii)supporting their growth and long-term
success in the marketplace and (iv) participating in the improving processes and standards of the seller support team.
This role will allow you to acquire competencies in all stages of the marketplace’s seller lifecycle. 
 
The ideal
candidate will have a seller-oriented and customer-obsessed mindset and strong motivation to build a career in
e-commerce. The ideal candidate is enthusiastic, detail-oriented and demonstrates ownership at his organization level.


Your missions will include:

* Onboarding new sellers: 
- Onboard our sellers: Integrate their catalogues and
configure their order management systems on the marketplace; 
- Guide our Manufacturers & Brands since the early stage
of the onboarding process : assess the technical integration with the manufacturer system ( ERP, API, integrator),
organise order testing, show efficient communication skills to find solutions with top management and technical experts
on the seller side. 
- Deal with connectors and integration’s partners (Lengow, Scaledev, etc.): acquire knowledge on
the solution proposed and coach the seller on it; 

* Support & Account Management:
- Operational management and
support of our seller’s accounts: Support them in the technical and operational set-up of their ManoMano account:
carrier pricing grids, products categorization, stock management, order management, etc. by showing ownership,
solution-oriented approach and driving the discovery of quick wins and workarounds to ensure seller satisfaction while
working on the long-term root cause resolution. Maintain high performance metrics such as SLA, Time to Resolve and
Productivity. Provide proactive spare extra training and content after support cases to prevent potential mistakes. 
-
Ensure the adoption of new seller’s tech tools in a proactive mode and contribute to their continuous improvement by
providing feedback and working closely with the tech teams in case of incidents. 
- Help our sellers grow their
business by improving our Customer Experience: monitor and ensure operational excellence of our sellers. - Ensure
proactive coaching to drive long-term business growth by improving CX and delivery promises. 

* Projets &
Initiatives:
- Participate in transversal initiatives with several internal stakeholders (Customer Service, Commercial
teams, Logistics, Tech .). 
- Contribute to the creation and optimization of the team’s tools and processes (SOP,
Demos, …) and participate in building up our internal knowledge base; 

Profile required:
- Bilingual in French; 
-
Previous experience in e-commerce or support services is a plus;
- English is a must, Spanish, German or Italian is a
plus;
- 100% seller-as-a-customer-oriented;
- Proactive, autonomous and flexible (capable of working in an
ever-changing environment);
- Curious with a strong desire to learn;
- Knowledge or strong willingness to learn and
work with technical tools (API, HTML,PIM, integrators etc.). Data-driven mindset & SQL skills will be a strong plus;
-
Team spirit and excellent relationship skills.

Operating as a marketplace, ManoMano is continuously
seeking for new value-added services for its sellers. ManoMano is looking for a senior advertising for partners campaign
specialist. We believe that advertising can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment
for our advertising partners. We are looking for a highly motivated Senior Advertising Campaign Specialist to join our
talented team to help scale our early-stage sponsored products program. Advertising Campaign Specialists partner with
Sales to drive advertiser success, revenue growth, and foster product improvements

As a senior advertising Campaign
Specialist you are passionate about understanding business drivers for performance. You play a key role working
cross-functionally with the sales team, growing the business by being the customer expert providing optimisation
recommendations. You possess analytical thinking, and will develop deep expertise in our sponsored products tools to
build winning campaigns by optimising performance and sharing insights to meet our advertisers’ needs. You are also
flexible and able to work in a constantly evolving scale-up environment and possess great communication
skills.

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Operating as a marketplace, ManoMano is continuously seeking for new value-added services for its sellers. ManoMano is looking for a senior advertising for partners campaign specialist. We believe that advertising can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment for our advertising partners. We are looking for a highly motivated Senior Advertising Campaign Specialist to join our talented team to help scale our early-stage sponsored products program. Advertising Campaign Specialists partner with Sales to drive advertiser success, revenue growth, and foster product improvements

As a senior advertising Campaign Specialist you are passionate about understanding business drivers for performance. You play a key role working cross-functionally with the sales team, growing the business by being the customer expert providing optimisation recommendations. You possess analytical thinking, and will develop deep expertise in our sponsored products tools to build winning campaigns by optimising performance and sharing insights to meet our advertisers’ needs. You are also flexible and able to work in a constantly evolving scale-up environment and possess great communication skills.

lists.content:
• Become an expert of our sponsored products program,

  • Work cross-functionally with sales and support them to deliver towards business goals. Extend your expertise and best practices to the sales to positively impact all new advertisers to the platform,

  • Help ensure that high potential advertisers reach their performance goals quickly and stay active and healthy,

  • Build campaign optimisation proposals that are meaningful, compelling and relevant to advertisers, 

  • Monitor account performance for optimal ROI and advertiser satisfaction and to provide oversight and root cause analysis of issues affecting advertisers,

  • Up-sell by using business analytics expertise to proactively identify opportunities to increase revenue and performance.

• Strong communication skills in English,

  • Graduated from a Business School / Engineering School (or equivalent university education),

  • 5+ years of experience with at least 2+ years of experience in digital advertising and client facing roles with a focus on data analysis,

  • Work experience in digital media including display/search advertising, campaign optimisation, analytics platforms, client management and business development,

  • Demonstrated ability with interpreting large data sets to make recommendations to clients or customers and/or internal partners,

  • Demonstrated high attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously,

  • Fluent in German, spanish, italian or chinese is a plus.

• Fast growing start-up environment
  • International & agile company 
  • Possible full remote
  • Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
  • DIY workshops and internal events
  • Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Barcelona & Bordeaux
  • 7 weeks holidays/year
  • Tickets restaurant

the DIY e-commerce space for both customers and sellers, ManoMano has launched Mano Fulfillment, a warehousing and
fulfillment service already implanted in France, Spain and Italy. 
Our objective is to grow 20 times our fulfillment
volume in the next 3 years, opening it in all our markets to help our sellers access our European markets in one
click.
As a Fulfillment Account Manager France, you will manage the business relationship with some of our partners and
will be responsible for driving the sales done through our Fulfillment solution.

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As part of its vision to offer the best experience in the DIY e-commerce space for both customers and sellers, ManoMano has launched Mano Fulfillment, a warehousing and fulfillment service already implanted in France, Spain and Italy. 
Our objective is to grow 20 times our fulfillment volume in the next 3 years, opening it in all our markets to help our sellers access our European markets in one click.
As a Fulfillment Account Manager France, you will manage the business relationship with some of our partners and will be responsible for driving the sales done through our Fulfillment solution.

lists.content:
• Manage your portfolio and make it grow fast with our logistics solution :

    • Negotiate with sellers to increase their assortment on ManoFulfillment as well as to strictly follow our stock recommendation,
    Follow closely the performance indicators to optimize the sales,
    Prepare and deliver Weekly and Monthly business reviews regarding progress and state of health for your key accounts,
    Train and coach sellers on how to use the different tools offered by ManoFulfillment, to make them fully autonomous on the solution,
    Proactively build joint business plans,
    Act as a point of escalation for seller issues, questions, or concerns.


  • Build long term ManoFulfillment solution, being the voice of ManoFulfillment Sellers :

    • Analyze business performances and conduct in-depth analysis to identify growth opportunities on the fulfillment solution,
    Continuously seek for sales, operational and process improvement identifying and managing projects to improve customer and selling partner experience,
    Develop a thorough understanding of the competitive environment including knowledge of competitive product offerings.

• Top Engineering or Business School with at least 5 years experience, ideally in the e-commerce industry,
  • Excellence in Excel with very strong analytical skills required, SQL is a plus,
  • Excellent project management, ability to work with legal, product, and other internal business owners to reach mutually beneficial agreements,
  • Strong business judgment and negotiation skills,
  • Autonomous, business driven, strong rigour,
  • Curious and passionate about innovation in Ecommerce/Marketplace,
  • Fluency in English and French,

• A start-up environment made in France in hyper growth,
  • Autonomy with a wide field of action,
  • An immersion in the data-driven e-commerce,
  • Agile & international environment with bright and friendly colleagues,
  • Telework possible one day/week,
  • The international dimension (France, Italy, Spain, United Kingdom, Germany),
  • A pleasant setting in Paris in more than 3,000 m² (a gym, a terrace, a music room),
  • Our DIY workshop, free access!
  • Restaurant card, mutual, transportation, 7 weeks vacation/year.

With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

STELLENBESCHREIBUNG

Das deutsche ManoMano Team gibt es seit über 5 Jahren, bereits über 22 Deutsche arbeiten in Paris für ManoMano.de. ManoMano Deutschland spielt eine wichtige Rolle beim schnellen Wachstum von ManoMano.
Direkt dem Lead Key Account Manager Deutschland unterstellt, bist Du verantwortlich für die Beziehung zu unseren wichtigsten deutschen Händlern. Die Händler sind sowohl auf der deutschen Plattform www.manomano.de, als auch auf den anderen ManoMano Plattformen (FR, IT, ES und UK) präsent.

lists.content:
• Du managst ein Portfolio von ausgewählten Händlern & entwickelst gemeinsam mit ihnen eine wirkungsvolle Strategie zur Steigerung ihrer Performance auf dem ManoMano-Marketplace:
    • -Aufbau und Pflege einer außergewöhnlichen Partnerschaft mit deinen Handelspartnern
    -Tiefgreifende und kontinuierliche Analyse der Geschäftsentwicklung zur Identifikation von Wachstumspotentialen
    -Erstellung und Kontrolle von Umsatz- und Profit-Zielen sowie Action Plans, um diese Ziele zu erreichen und zu übertreffen
    -Identifikation ungenutzter Händlerpotentiale und deren Erschließung
    -Kontinuierliche Verbesserung von Verkaufs- und  Prozessabläufen
    -Zusammenarbeit und Koordination mit den internationalen ManoMano-Teams zur Gewährleistung einer ganzheitlichen, länderübergreifenden Händlerbetreuung
    -Mitwirken bei der Entwicklung der Vertriebsstrategie inkl. der Sortiments- und Konditionspolitik sowie der geeigneten Verkaufsförderungsmaßnahmen

  • Außerdem arbeitest du aktiv an der Erstellung und Umsetzung von Marketing-Maßnahmen für die deutsche ManoMano-Plattform:
    • -Definition von Promotion-Maßnahmen in Zusammenarbeit mit der Marketing-Abteilung
    -Erstellung der Produktauswahl mit saisonaler Relevanz
    -Permanente Verhandlung der besten Werbepreise mit deinen Händlern
    -Erfolgskontrolle und kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Effizienz und Effektivität unserer Werbemaßnahmen

• Du verfügst über eine kaufmännische Grundbildung mit betriebswirtschaftlicher Weiterbildung oder eine adäquate Ausbildung (z.B. Uni, FH etc.), und konntest Dich schon mindestens zwei Jahre erfolgreich in einer Position im Vertrieb, Einkauf oder Consulting beweisen, idealerweise in einem Unternehmen des E-Commerce. 
  • Du verfügst über ein ausgezeichnetes analytisches Denken, bist datengetrieben und bringst ein gutes Verständnis und Begeisterung für E-Commerce und die deutsche Handelslandschaft mit.
  • Als kompetenter und redegewandter Gesprächspartner führst Du nicht nur Verhandlungen mit Entscheidern auf hohem Niveau, sondern kennst auch die Ziele und Potentiale unserer Händler. Du strebst ein partnerschaftliches Wachstum an, und überzeugst durch hohes Kunden- und Serviceverständnis.
  • Verhandlungssichere Deutsch-Kenntnisse und Französisch oder Englisch sind für diese Position zwingend notwendig. 
  • Du arbeitest selbstständig und präzise, besitzt Überzeugungs- und Durchsetzungskraft, hast  Teamgeist und bist sympathisch. Bei ManoMano sind wir in erster Linie auf der Suche nach tollen Persönlichkeiten.

• Eine „Made in France“ Start-Up Atmosphäre mit toller Arbeitsstimmung
  • Möglichkeit zur Arbeit in 100% HomeOffice mit Wohnsitz in Deutschland oder Frankreich
  • Vom Unternehmen bezahlte Geschäftsreisen
  • Eine „Made in France“ Start-Up Atmosphäre mit toller Arbeitsstimmung
  • Viel Autonomie und Spielraum bei Deiner Arbeit
  • Eintauchen in die schnellwachsende, datenfokussierte Welt des E-Commerce
  • Ein internationales Umfeld (Mitarbeiter aus 25 Nationen)
  • Tolle Standorte in Paris / Bordeaux und Barcelona
  • Für Frankreich : “Tickets Restaurant“ (ein finanzieller Zuschuss zum Mittagessen), Zuschuss zu den Kosten für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel
  • Für Deutschland : monatlicher Homeoffice-Zuschuss
  • Französisch- oder Englischunterricht
  • (Virtuelle) Company- und Team-Events, DIY-Ateliers
  • Regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche und interne Mobility-Angebote

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY,
home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products.
With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6
countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a
quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Context

The Experience Design team is part of the Marketing & Growth department
at ManoMano, together with Brand, Commerce and Digital Marketing teams.
Currently, almost 20 designers and user
researchers are working together in order to design and deliver best-in-class products & services to our users &
customers, and support business growth ambitions.

We are looking for a Senior UX/UI designer to join the Experience
Design team and work on our e-commerce Application for our Pros customers (BtB).
The ideal candidate will have proven
experience expanding, driving, and implementing UX vision in order to design and build memorable experiences..
Additionally, the candidate will possess an exceptional ability to collaborate across large teams and pitch/evangelize
ideas as part of a larger-scale creative framework.
This role reports to the Sr BtB UX
Lead.

Responsibilities

Frame and solve problems weaving together experiences that take the user needs, business
goals and technology into account
Start with user! Leverage what we learn from our user researches and turn those
insights into best-in-class user experiences
Drive your own product discovery including Product Managers in order to
understand your users pain points by collecting users’ feedbacks (qualitative research) and putting it together with
datas
Distill ideas, clearly communicate and articulate the “why” of design decisions in order to influence your
stakeholders and build consensus
Inspire and align the team around user experience by developing user flows and
interfaces informed by user interactions and product requirements
Work closely with the App Team, meaning Product
Manager, engineers and also Business Owners in order to get buy-in and alignment on your design recommendations
Spread
a user-centric mindset through impactful design methodologies and regular sessions with users. 
Collaborate with others
designers and developers to maintain design consistency and coherence across our product ecosystem.
Align and
synchronize on a regular basis with App Lead in order to prevent discrepancies and reduce design debts.


Expected
skills & experience

5+ years of experience as a Product Designer, UX designer or similar role, working on
consumer-facing and B2B products.
Be passionate about Apps, interest and knowledge on fundamentals, and structural
approaches in native app industries.
A demonstrated ability to communicate UX vision and to align vision with internal
stakeholders and an intended market.
Extensive experience conducting co-design sessions with users and managing
asynchronous user tests.
An exceptional ability to conceptualize, pitch and implement UX concepts
Deep familiarity
with Application design and related UX principles, methodologies and best practices including user-centered
approaches.
Extensive knowledge and experience designing in Figma, Sketch, InVision and Adobe Suite.
An understanding
or previous experience designing/working with Design Systems
An understanding of how design impacts development and a
knack for constructing delightful designs that are technically feasible.


About you

Full of empathy for
users
Positive attitude and an ability to receive and provide objective feedback
Self-motivated, collaborative,
excellent interpersonal and communication skills
A self-starter who’s strategic, passionate and thoughtful about
her/his work
Ability to challenge the status quo and envision innovative solutions
Eager to be part of a fast-paced
environment in a hyper-growth company.
A joy to work with
Collaboration enthusiast

Sounds like you ? Let’s get in
touch!

Context

The Experience Design team is part of the Marketing & Growth department at ManoMano, together with Brand, Commerce and Digital Marketing teams.
Currently, almost 20 designers and user researchers are working together in order to design and deliver best-in-class products & services to our users & customers, and support business growth ambitions.

We are looking for a Senior UX/UI designer to join the Experience Design team and work on our e-commerce Application for our Pros customers (BtB).
The ideal candidate will have proven experience expanding, driving, and implementing UX vision in order to design and build memorable experiences.. Additionally, the candidate will possess an exceptional ability to collaborate across large teams and pitch/evangelize ideas as part of a larger-scale creative framework.

Responsibilities

Frame and solve problems weaving together experiences that take the user needs, business goals and technology into account
Start with user! Leverage what we learn from our user researches and turn those insights into best-in-class user experiences
Drive your own product discovery including Product Managers in order to understand your users pain points by collecting users’ feedbacks (qualitative research) and putting it together with datas
Distill ideas, clearly communicate and articulate the “why” of design decisions in order to influence your stakeholders and build consensus
Inspire and align the team around user experience by developing user flows and interfaces informed by user interactions and product requirements
Work closely with the App Team, meaning Product Manager, engineers and also Business Owners in order to get buy-in and alignment on your design recommendations
Spread a user-centric mindset through impactful design methodologies and regular sessions with users. 
Collaborate with others designers and developers to maintain design consistency and coherence across our product ecosystem.
Align and synchronize on a regular basis with App Lead in order to prevent discrepancies and reduce design debts.


Expected skills & experience

5+ years of experience as a Product Designer, UX designer or similar role, working on consumer-facing and B2B products.
Be passionate about Apps, interest and knowledge on fundamentals, and structural approaches in native app industries.
A demonstrated ability to communicate UX vision and to align vision with internal stakeholders and an intended market.
Extensive experience conducting co-design sessions with users and managing asynchronous user tests.
An exceptional ability to conceptualize, pitch and implement UX concepts
Deep familiarity with Application design and related UX principles, methodologies and best practices including user-centered approaches.
Extensive knowledge and experience designing in Figma, Sketch, InVision and Adobe Suite.
An understanding or previous experience designing/working with Design Systems
An understanding of how design impacts development and a knack for constructing delightful designs that are technically feasible.


About you

Full of empathy for users
Positive attitude and an ability to receive and provide objective feedback
Self-motivated, collaborative, excellent interpersonal and communication skills
A self-starter who’s strategic, passionate and thoughtful about her/his work
Ability to challenge the status quo and envision innovative solutions
Eager to be part of a fast-paced environment in a hyper-growth company.
A joy to work with
Collaboration enthusiast

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the
European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of
DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850
Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2,
Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity
and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Your missions

As a visitor on ManoMano website, you might have a question about a
product, need help looking for the right tool or even need guidance in your DIY project. 
The Expert Advice feature
team's mission is to build the solutions to offer help from DIY experts to our visitors to increase sales and customer
satisfaction. Advice is one of ManoMano key differentiators and an important contributor to our business.

By joining
this feature team you will have a unique opportunity to work on large scale projects with a strong business
impact.
Your challenge as a senior backend engineer will be to build, deliver and operate microservices related to
expert advice, from design to production, with a strong focus on reliability, performance and
maintainability.


Context
- Tech team composed of 300+ engineers
- Agile mindset since the birth of ManoMano:
Scrum and SAFe is widely applied
- 3 offices (Paris, Bordeaux and Barcelona) with up to 100% remote
- Our working
language is mostly in english. We are using French as well, and some of us talks Spanish/German/Italian...


Main
activities

You will join a team, composed of 4 frontend and backend developers, a tech lead and a product manager, in
order to provide our visitors with the best possible advice, with the support of other teams (Product, UX/UI, SRE,
Agile, QA, Platform engineering…).
As a senior software engineer in this team, you will have to :

- Design and build
new features
- Maintain and decommission legacy applications
- Assimilate business context and company expectations to
be creative and relevant
- Learn & teach through mentoring, pair programming, code reviews, knowledge transfer
-
Continuously improve the quality of our processes and technical components
- Deploy our code up to production and
proactively monitor it
- Contribute to the ManoMano shared assets (libraries, tools, etc.)


Technical stack 
-
Microservices in Spring Boot and Java 11 (soon 17)
- Architecture inspired from the Hexagonal and Clean Architecture
-
PostgreSQL, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Redis
- Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
- Kong, Keycloak
- Gitlab CI/CD
- Datadog,
Sentry, Slack, Jira

We also develop frontend applications, built with React, Next.js, Redux-Saga, React Admin, on
which you would be more than welcome to contribute.
We do have 2 legacy applications written in PHP that we are phasing
out.
There are also opportunities within the company to later work on projects built with Kotlin, Go, Python or
PHP.


Requirements
- 3+ years of experience as a backend engineer
- Interest for frontend development would be a
plus
- Agile, DevOps and product minded
- Data driven in decision making
- Team spirit, willing to help wherever it
is needed (monitoring, leading agile rituals, decommissioning legacy code, writing documentation, mentoring
teammates…)
- Be lazy, automate things in order to helps us be more scalable and efficient
- Fluent in english
- Able
to work in a fast changing (and not perfect) environment
- Taste for continuous improvement, with a strong desire to
test, experiment and share better solutions

Context
- Tech team composed of 300+ engineers
- Agile mindset since the birth of ManoMano: Scrum and SAFe is widely applied
- 3 offices (Paris, Bordeaux and Barcelona) with up to 100% remote
- Our working language is mostly in english. We are using French as well, and some of us talks Spanish/German/Italian...


Main activities

You will join a team, composed of 4 frontend and backend developers, a tech lead and a product manager, in order to provide our visitors with the best possible advice, with the support of other teams (Product, UX/UI, SRE, Agile, QA, Platform engineering…).
As a senior software engineer in this team, you will have to :

- Design and build new features
- Maintain and decommission legacy applications
- Assimilate business context and company expectations to be creative and relevant
- Learn & teach through mentoring, pair programming, code reviews, knowledge transfer
- Continuously improve the quality of our processes and technical components
- Deploy our code up to production and proactively monitor it
- Contribute to the ManoMano shared assets (libraries, tools, etc.)


Technical stack 
- Microservices in Spring Boot and Java 11 (soon 17)
- Architecture inspired from the Hexagonal and Clean Architecture
- PostgreSQL, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Redis
- Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
- Kong, Keycloak
- Gitlab CI/CD
- Datadog, Sentry, Slack, Jira

We also develop frontend applications, built with React, Next.js, Redux-Saga, React Admin, on which you would be more than welcome to contribute.
We do have 2 legacy applications written in PHP that we are phasing out.
There are also opportunities within the company to later work on projects built with Kotlin, Go, Python or PHP.


Requirements
- 3+ years of experience as a backend engineer
- Interest for frontend development would be a plus
- Agile, DevOps and product minded
- Data driven in decision making
- Team spirit, willing to help wherever it is needed (monitoring, leading agile rituals, decommissioning legacy code, writing documentation, mentoring teammates…)
- Be lazy, automate things in order to helps us be more scalable and efficient
- Fluent in english
- Able to work in a fast changing (and not perfect) environment
- Taste for continuous improvement, with a strong desire to test, experiment and share better solutions

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the
European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of
DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850
Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2,
Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity
and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Background and Missions 

ManoMano, already positioned as European leader in DIY,
wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. Our company is growing fast and wants to structure its
teams. We are looking for a Senior Java Backend Developer in Paris to join the Marketplace Finance feature team in the
Buyers perimeter. 

The Marketplace Finance feature team is responsible for all activities related to the payment of
our sellers :

Marketplace invoices, payment of their sales, financial reports and seller payment backoffice. Our goal
is to provide the best seller experience related to the management of their financial flow with ManoMano. 

Your
challenge as a Senior Java Backend Engineer will be to work on existing microservices and creating new ones, ensuring a
good level of architecture, scalability, robustness, consistency and performance required by using concepts such as
idempotency, distributed services, reactive architecture, back pressure and more to guarantee a quality of seller
finance service for years to come.

Responsibilities 

You will join a team, composed of 4 Developers + 1 Lead + 1
Product Manager, in order to create, in collaboration with the product team, an amazing experience for the merchants.


As a senior software engineer in this team, you will have to :

- Design and develop features with a high quality
standard

- Assimilate business context and company expectations to be creative and relevant

- Improve the quality
technical components

- Deploy your code up to production and be involved in monitoring it

- Coach and help
developers to grow and improve

Stack

Microservices 
Java 11
SpringBoot 2
Quarkus
PostgreSQL
RabbitMQ,
Kafka
Gitlab + Gitlab CI/CD
DockerAWS ECS / EKS
Jira / Miro / Confluence / Slack / Gsuite

Requirements

 - 4+
years of experience as a backend developer
- Creative / Innovative
- Data Driven in decision making
- Fluent in
english
- Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment)
- Team spirit and excellent
interpersonal skills, as well as a good sense of humor!
- Curious with a strong desire to test and experiment new
solutions in your work
- New technologies / e-commerce have no secrets for you

What we offer at ManoMano

People:
Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere
Work: office/
hybrid/ full remote 
Salary: competitive salary package
Technology: Get a laptop you love to do your best work
Time
off: 7 weeks of paid vacation + vacation premium $$
Sports: free gym 
Healthcare: mutual (60% taken care by MM)

Retreats/ fun: music room/ a terrace/ modern office/ Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge,
learn from others)/ External events attendance, fairs & Meetups
Food: all the coffee you can drink/ Restaurant card
(Swile)
Transportation: 50% reimbursement
MM employee discount
Parents: flexible
policies

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader
specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening
online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer
across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos,
including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and
Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and
care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to
put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Background and Missions 

ManoMano, already positioned as European leader in DIY,
wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. Our company is growing fast and wants to structure its
teams. We are looking for a Backend Developer in Paris or Bordeaux to improve the order experience of our customers on
the Buyers Gear. 
You will join the CS Operations Team who is in charge of the order life cycle. From the product
selected by our customers to the final order generated for our sellers, you will be involved in all aspects of how you
can buy a product at ManoMano.

The team is based at Bordeaux and this position is open onsite or in full remote but
ONLY FROM FRANCE LOCATION.

Responsibilities 

You will join a team, composed of 5 members, in order to create, in
collaboration with the product teams, an amazing experience for the merchants and the customers.
As a software engineer
in this team, you will have to : 
- Design and develop features with a high quality standard
- Assimilate business
context and company expectations to be creative and relevant
- Learn & teach through code reviews
- Improve the
quality and testing of technical components
- Deploy your code up to production and be involved in monitoring
it

Stack

- Microservices 
- Kotlin >= 1.4 with SpringBoot 2 (Java >=11)
- Docker / Kubernetes
- PostgreSQL,
MySQL
- RabbitMQ, Kafka
- Git + Gitlab CI/CD
- Docker, AWS, EKS

Requirements

 - 2+ years of experience as a
backend developer
- Creative / Innovative
- Data Driven in decision making
- Fluent in english
- Autonomous and
adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment)
- Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills, as well
as a good sense of humor!
- Curious with a strong desire to test and experiment new solutions in your work
- TDD, DDD,
BDD is not just abbreviation for you
- New technologies / e-commerce have no secrets for you

What we offer at
ManoMano

- Fast growing start-up environment
- international (20+ nationalties) & agile company
- Sponsorings to
external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
- Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share
your knowledges, learn from others)
- Swile card for lunch
- 60% company medical insurance
- 7 weeks of payed
vacation
- Choose your days of remote work per week
- Parenthood
- Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Bordeaux &
Barcelona
- Attractive salary (package)
- Mac, PC or Linux: it’s up to you!

Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As Senior Business Developer, you will recruit our future UK DIY vendors, analyse their offer and then work with them to grow their sales performance. You have a good knowledge of the B2B sales process, are equipped with a strong analytical mind-set and have excellent relationship building skills. You will be able to identify and onboard our future partners with the strongest business potential and help grow our existing partners to achieve very ambitious growth targets!

lists.content:
• Hunting, hunting hunting! You will analyse competitor selection, identify sellers with the highest potential for the UK ManoMano platform and then convince them to partner with us
  • Qualify and develop new business opportunities from outbound/inbound calls, leads and general prospecting. This includes cold calling and networking in the region to develop one’s own opportunities
  • You will pitch the ManoMano proposition to new vendors by phone (and on occasion face to face) and secure best business conditions to ensure the highest chance of success
  • You will negotiate best business terms with sellers including commercial terms, promotional planning, marketing
  • You will manage completely the integration and business performance of your portfolio of new and existing vendors and be required to report on performances
  • You will overcome any obstacles autonomously with innovative solutions and by prioritizing effectively
  • Involvement in transversal business projects

• You are passionate about Enterprise selling, Business Development B2B and the world of e-commerce!
  • Fluent English Speaker
  • You have at least 3 years of work experience as a business developer or account manager. Ideally in a fast pace, high growth environment
  • You have a good knowledge of B2B sales process, retail and sales strategies
  • You have a good knowledge of Excel and very strong analytical skills
  • Autonomous, business driven, strong rigour in the workplace
  • Ease at pitching and negotiating commercial terms with business owners and senior leadership
  • You have a Business Owner mentality, love the world of start-ups and are prepared to roll up your sleeves up!

• Fast growing start-up environment
  • International & agile company 
  • Possible full remote
  • Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
  • DIY workshops and internal events
  • Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Barcelona & Bordeaux
  • 7 weeks holidays/year
  • Tickets restaurant

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in
DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

We are willing to take it to the next level on the B2B markets. This means, among
other things, reinforcing our category management approach, with a multispecialist, category driven mindset. 

As part
of the B2B Category Management team, you report directly to the lead of the category. Your main responsibility is to
enable the performance of your category through selection and onsite optimisation preco. You are, a true market expert
and you bring your previous experience of B2B market retail to reinforce our capabilities.

Your missions cover our 4
countries and are the following:

Selection :
- You build the selection target per category and country in terms of
needs, brands or products, based on market and intern inputs
- You closely monitor and share the level of coverage and
competitiveness expected by pros at category level and the current level to feed your stakeholders
- You identify key
competitors and leverage ManoMano internal competency to gather all the informations needed
- Your inputs are built to
be easily activable by your stakeholders

Monitoring :
- Track performance of the selection and always improve the
target, understand performance and non-performance and modify your inputs based on it
- Integrate your strategy in
Quarterly roadmaps on your family to help spart be as efficient as possible with different level of details depending of
the maturity of the market
- Assist Spart negotiation when needed to support them technically
- Involve stakeholders
teams (CX, quality) 

Market knowledge and study :
- You keep up to date of market consommation trends and market
competitions dynamics
- You build and share dedicated market study if needed
- You are able to accompain our sourcing
team in negociation with partner and provide informations needed.
 
You work closely with your merchandising partner
to ensure your strategy is deployed online.


REQUIREMENTS

You already have a significant experience in the B2B
field.
Your understanding of the markets, your knowledge of products and customers is like no other. You are curious
and looking for a new challenge, in a digital, fast paced and international environment.

We are looking for someone
with the following qualities:
- Customer oriented, their experience is your priority
- Market oriented - you
understand all our external stakeholders driver
- Caring, curious and open minded
- Top analytical skills (Excel,
SQL)
- Speaking English, knowledge of German is a plus

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As part of the Sellers’ Partnership team, you will be responsible for defining the partnership strategy to build a solid connectors ecosystem for MM’s sellers, in collaboration with Product, Tech and Seller Support teams. You will be responsible for this project within MM and in particular for the transversal coordination necessary to ensure its success, based on the creation of strong synergies between our integrators and e-commerce platforms’ partners who will become prescribers of our marketplace solution. This project is a major enabler to ensure the strong growth ambitions of the company.
This position can be based in Paris or full-remotely from anywhere in France or in Spain.

lists.text:
You will have the following
main activities:
lists.content:
• Imagining and structuring the economic models of the partnerships, in order to meet the sellers’ needs in each of our markets;
  • Identify, target and approach key partners, like CMS (Eg.: Prestashop, Magento, etc.), integrators (Eg.: Lengow, ShoppingFeed, Linworks, ChannelPilot, etc.) and other e-commerce service providers.
  • Promote and participate in the marketplaces ecosystem and represent MM: you will act as an ambassador for our solution in order to create a close relationship with tech partners;
  • Negotiate and establish contracts, ensure the animation and deployment of signed partnerships;
  • Measure and optimize the results of each partnership;
  • Coordinate resources dedicated to the project, in particular with the Seller Support, Product and Tech teams.

• Competent and business oriented leader with minimum 7 years of relevant experience in business development, management and ecommerce, used to communicate clearly and effectively (written & verbal) with business leaders, able to lead and carry teams and ambitious projects. Previous marketplace/integrator experience is a real advantage.
  • Excellent digital culture & deep understanding of the marketplace business models. 
  • Proven successful track record growing a business, market planning/analysis and opportunity identification.
  • Strong organizational planning and development skills.
  • Be able to drive projects, tackle complex situations, always using data, coordinate and develop teams.  
  • Bac +5 graduated from a Engineering School, University-degree in Economics, International Business or similar.
  • Data Driven, people know you for your analytical and synthetic mind.
  • Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment).
  • Curious, with a strong desire to learn.
  • Proactive, collaborative and solutions oriented.

ManoMano wants to offer an exceptional customer experience (CX) and be
a leader in this field. For this, as a trusted intermediary, ManoMano must manage the quality of service offered by its
sellers (mainly, but not only, on delivery efficiency and after-sales service).The Sellers Quality Team is dedicated to
ensuring a top of class CX is offered to all ManoMano customers, and is looking for Program Managers. 
 
As a Program
Manager, you define the level of CX we want to offer to our customers, and you ensure that our sellers are offering a
seamless & flawless experience to our customers in all our platforms in Europe. You define and build the relevant
metrics and processes to assess seller performance and take actions when necessary. You also work closely with our
product and tech teams to implement projects that will support our sellers in meeting the objectives you set. 
 

In
particular, you will have the following missions:

- Become an expert on customer experience and seller performance
challenges and drive continuous improvement in delivering best-in-class customer experience while the business continues
its rapid growth. 
To do so, you will need to identify opportunities to improve pre-sales and after-sales customer
experience, participate and coordinate the solution definition process, the seller’s adoption and monitoring. 

-
Build governance, solid plan (roadmap), KPIs and process to own the entire execution of the programs that will monitor
and improve customer experience and seller performance. 
You will lead and participate in end-to-end strategic
projects, including feature launches and process improvements, involving several internal stakeholders. 
 
- Monitor
and improve our current processes (alerts, recommendations, …) to ensure that they are efficient, fair and respect our
commitments towards our sellers. 

- Monitor and report on a weekly and monthly basis all KPIs related to CX and
leverage data to find root causes for improvement or degradation of any KPI.
You will also support our account managers
and seller support teams by providing them with the tools and data necessary for them to give valuable advice to the
sellers in their portfolio on pre and post-sales customer experience topics ( delivery promise and execution, CS
management, reverse logistics etc.) 
You will also be in charge of anticipating operational issues at platform level
when sales increases are expected (marketing operations, exceptional situations,..) and align with relevant internal
stakeholders (transport team, Account managers) to take preventive actions. 

- Manage unexpected incidents action
plans with an impact on customer’s and seller’s by aligning internal stakeholders and ensuring rapid and effective
actions and monitoring. 


Profile required:

- Graduated from a Business or Engineering school, you want to evolve
in an e-commerce environment in a position which mixes analyse and commercial skills.
- You have 4/5 years of
experience on project management positions which required you to develop strategic and analytics skills;
- You are
passionate about e-commerce topics and want to revolutionize customer experience;
- You are known for your excellent
rigor, and you have developed strong interpersonal skills;
- You are mastering Excel and ideally have SQL notions;
-
Anglais and French bilingual, another ManoMano language spoken (Italian, Spanish or German) is a
plus.

To do so, you will need to identify opportunities to improve pre-sales and after-sales customer experience, participate and coordinate the solution definition process, the seller’s adoption and monitoring.

- Monitor and improve our current processes (alerts, recommendations, …) to ensure that they are efficient, fair and respect our commitments towards our sellers.

Profile required:

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic

Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

The Growth team is transversal to the ‘Digital Marketing’ team, working hand-in-hand
with the different sub-teams, such as Acquisition, Retention, Advice, CRM and SEO. 
As a senior Data & Business Analyst
you will not only support but also be expected to bring actionable recommendations and deliverables.
If you love
managing cross-functional stakeholders, driving projects forward to deliver measurable and strategically meaningful
results, solving problems, then this role is for you.

Your main tasks will include:

Understand, explain & optimize
ManoMano’s business performances
- Become expert for the Digital Marketing teams and act as a subject Matter Expert 
-
Develop & automate analysis to understand the business performances based on web analytics tools , Visualization tools /
SQL / Python (more details can be given in the interviews)
- Proactively detect issues and identify their root cause
-
Identify and size drivers of growth (optimization & pain points resolution), autonomously provide recommendations

Act
as the ‘data point of entry’ for the Digital Marketing team
- Identify, define & prioritize needs for data products/
optimizations/ analysis
- Monitor & drive the delivery of these data projects in collaboration with the data teams of
ManoMano (Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Intelligence)

Deep dive ad ’hoc business
problems/ analytics requests for different teams
- Tackle ad ’hoc business topics autonomously, managing the
‘analytical loop’ and deriving recommendations to the CODIR

Ensure the best data appropriation & use by teams
-
Democratize data within your scope
- Guarantee that analytical methodologies are correctly applied 

→ Your job will
have a considerable impact on ManoMano’s growth

#Li-hybrid
#Li-remote

the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest
offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings
together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently
are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic
environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Inside the ‘Insight Advanced Analytics’ team, the Business & data analytics team is
transversal to the company, tackling issues for the different teams ranging from sourcing (recommendations), operations
(forecasts), product (web analytics)... Data analyst will work hand-by-hand with those teams, not acting as support but
bringing actionable insights & recommendations.

If you love managing cross-functional stakeholders, pushing projects
forward to deliver measurable and strategically meaningful results, and solving problems from both 30,000 feet as well
as deep in the details, this is the role for you.

Your main tasks will include:

1)Understand, explain & optimize
ManoMano’s business performances through test measurements
-Become an expert on conducting and measuring increments of
complex a/b tests: ManoMano has an a/b test culture and makes all strategic decisions based on their results (more
details can be given in the interviews)
-Develop & automate analysis to understand the business performances

-Proactively detect issues and identify their root cause

2)Act as the ‘data point of entry’ for the different
teams
-Identify, define & prioritize needs for data products/ optimizations/ analysis
-Monitor & drive the delivery of
these data projects (data engineering, data science, data analytics…)

3)Ensure the best data appropriation & use by
teams
-Democratize data (trainings, dissemination & usage of tools)-
-Guarantee that analytical methodologies are
correctly applied 

This position is highly strategic and requires to combine a strong analytical mindset, a business
acumen and advanced analytical capabilities (SQL and Python are a must-have). 
→ Your job will have a considerable
impact on ManoMano’s growth and strategic decisions

We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering qualitatives products that we will be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionize their online DIY experience.
 
As a fast growing company, we are always on the look for ingenious and passionate people.

lists.text: At ManoMano, we love and aspire to
lists.content:
• Push often and serenely to production
  • Monitor code and functionalities (mistakes, product metrics)
  • Take advantage of containers flexibility (docker)
  • Leverage cloud scalability (AWS)
  • Migrate to a micro-services architecture
  • Cultivating continuous improvement

• Build an efficient and robust architecture to store and make accessible data terabytes, in an hyper-growing environment
  • Optimize and create data workflows to our Data lake and our data dissemination systems (datawarehouse, APIs, event buses, etc.)
  • Identify data needs of different teams, especially when launching new projects; design the systems to meet those needs, in a high performance logic
  • Work and data quality & reliability to ensure we provide trustable metrics to the whole company 
  • Participate or lead futurs projects in a fast growing scale-up

lists.text: Technical stack in Data Engineering Team
lists.content:
• Cloud AWS : S3, Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, MSK, ECS, ECR
  • Data platform : Snowflake (Datawarehouse), Airflow, Snowplow, MariaDB/PostgreSQL
  • Ops : Terraform, Ansible, Docker
  • Messaging / Realtime ingestion : Kafka, RabbitMQ
  • Development : Python, SQL

• 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer
  • Good experience in Python & SQL
  • Technically knowledgeable / “a doer” - not afraid to DO, participate and help others / you are not afraid to take initiatives and offer new solutions
  • Innovative and creative
  • Excellente digital culture and Data Driven
  • Autonomous and adaptable (desire to work in a fast growing environment / Start-up)
  • Humble et curious with a big appetite to learn discover and experiment new things
  • Team spirit and  great communication skills
  • You come to work with good intentions and good vibes
  • High level of English

• Experience on AWS
  • Knowledge of Airflow
  • Knowledge of Kafka

• - Fast growing start-up environment
  • - International (20+ nationalties) & agile company
  • - Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
  • - Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledges, learn from others)
  • - Swile card for lunch
  • - 60% company medical insurance
  • - 7 weeks of paid vacation
  • - Full remote possible from France location only (choose your days of remote work per week)
  • - Parenthood
  • - Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Bordeaux & Barcelona
  • - Attractive salary (package)
  • - Mac, PC or Linux: it’s up to you!
