descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in
DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across
6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including
a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Be challenged at ManoMano. The Machine Learning team is an applied ML team with a
focus on delivery. We’re outcome-oriented: we solve high-impact business problems and deliver value to our users in
production.

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to be part of a team of best-in-class ML practitioners focused on
personalization (search and recommender systems) and the quality of our catalog (e.g., product categorization or product
attribute extraction).

You’ll be joining a team of top-tier Data Scientists with probably some of the strongest
modeling skills in the French Tech Next40. The ML team was instrumental in the growth of ManoMano from the very
beginning and is now fully committed to building ML data products on our marketplace in this hypergrowth stage. 

This
is the opportunity to contribute to one of Europe’s highest-valued unicorn companies and tap into one of the largest
e-commerce data sets in the world to build the algorithms that power our internal and external products.

We have
several roles open across different levels of seniority. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and
experience solving tough problems with large datasets.
description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Be challenged at ManoMano. The Machine Learning team is an applied ML team with a focus on delivery. We’re outcome-oriented: we solve high-impact business problems and deliver value to our users in production.

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to be part of a team of best-in-class ML practitioners focused on personalization (search and recommender systems) and the quality of our catalog (e.g., product categorization or product attribute extraction).

You’ll be joining a team of top-tier Data Scientists with probably some of the strongest modeling skills in the French Tech Next40. The ML team was instrumental in the growth of ManoMano from the very beginning and is now fully committed to building ML data products on our marketplace in this hypergrowth stage. 

This is the opportunity to contribute to one of Europe’s highest-valued unicorn companies and tap into one of the largest e-commerce data sets in the world to build the algorithms that power our internal and external products.

We have several roles open across different levels of seniority. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background and experience solving tough problems with large datasets.

lists.content:
• Apply machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques to build new ML. product features, creating new and improving internal and external-facing data products.
  • Own the ML lifecycle, from experimentation and prototyping to deployment into production pipelines.
  • Write production model code and implement algorithms in production.
  • Perform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of the problem.
  • Investigate and fix a production issue from a data product your team owns.
  • Partner with software engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to frame problems, both mathematically and within the business context.
  • Share your knowledge and expertise with the rest of the team.

• User-focused.
  • 3+ years of industry experience applying Machine Learning to business problems and building ML models for production.
  • A Bachelor or Master’s Degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
  • Solid knowledge of Machine Learning theory, statistics, and probabilities.
  • Strong coding experience in Python and proficiency in SQL. You care about code simplicity and performance.
  • Proficient oral and written communication skills in English. We’re a remote-first team, so good writing is key. French is not required.
  • Growth mindset: love learning and seek challenges.

• Built large-scale production ML models and systems.
  • Expertise in search, ranking, recommendation systems, information retrieval, natural language processing (NLP), visual recognition, or reinforcement learning (RL).
  • Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field.
  • You are a Kaggle Competitions Expert.
  • Professional experience in a technology company setting involving a product, an e-commerce platform, or a consumer-facing marketplace.
  • Experience using data processing (e.g., Apache Spark, Apache Flink, or Apache Beam) or deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or Tensorflow).
  • Strong core computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, architecting systems).

• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere
  • Work: office/ hybrid/ full remote  
  • Salary: competitive salary package
  • Technology: Get a laptop you love to do your best work
  • Time off: 7 weeks of paid vacation + vacation premium $$
  • Sports: free gym (Paris office)
  • Healthcare: mutual (60% taken care by MM) 
  • Retreats/ fun: music room/ a terrace/ modern office/  Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge, learn from others)/ External events attendance, fairs & Meetups
  • Food: all the coffee you can drink/ Restaurant card (Swile)
  • Transportation: 50% reimbursement
  • MM employee discount
  • Parents: flexible policies

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY,
home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products.
With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6
countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a
quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona).
People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is
a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on
innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Context

The Experience Design team is part of the Growth Marketing Department at
ManoMano, together with Brand, Commerce and Digital Marketing teams.
Currently, almost 20 designers and user
researchers are working together in order to design and deliver best-in-class products & services to our users &
customers, and support business growth ambitions.

We are looking for a Senior Lead UX Design to join the Experience
Design team and take in charge our BtB platform & Buyer scope.
The ideal candidate will have proven experience
expanding, leading, and implementing UX vision in order to design and build memorable experiences.. Additionally, the
candidate will possess an exceptional ability to collaborate across large teams in order to get alignment on the UX
vision. The management of a team of 3 to 5 UX designers is also a big part of this role.

This role reports to the
Head of Design.

Responsibilities

- Manage a team of 3 to 5 user designers, lead and prioritize their roadmaps in
collaboration and synchronisation with the other UX Leads
- Coordinate and drive the design thinking process within
your cross-functional team
- Lead design reviews with your team and ensure the quality of the deliverables.
-
Collaborate and coordinate with our user researchers in order to leverage what we learn from our user researches and
turn those insights into best-in-class user experiences by defining and creating functional and delightful solutions
-
Based on that, lead your team to identify opportunities, frame and solve problems weaving together experiences that take
the user needs, business goals and technology into account
- Distill ideas, clearly communicate and articulate the UX
strategy of your scope in order to influence your stakeholders and co-build the Product roadmaps
- Work with your peers
in other disciplines and teams to contribute to the Product and business vision
- Make sure your UX recommendations get
implemented.
- Ensure that your team of designers maintain design consistency and coherence across our product
ecosystem.

Expected skills & experience

- 10+ years of experience as a Product Designer, UX designer with at least
2 years managing a team of designers working on consumer-facing and B2B websites.
- A demonstrated ability to
communicate UX vision and to align vision with internal stakeholders and an intended market.
- Great coordination and
management skills
- An exceptional ability to conceptualize, pitch and implement UX concepts
- Deep familiarity with
UX principles, methodologies and best practices including user-centered approaches.
- Extensive knowledge and
experience designing in Figma, Sketch, InVision and Adobe Suite.

About you

- Full of empathy for users
- Positive
attitude and an ability to receive and provide objective feedback
- Self-motivated, collaborative, excellent
interpersonal and communication skills
- A self-starter who’s strategic, passionate and thoughtful about her/his
work
- Ability to challenge the status quo and envision innovative solutions
- Eager to be part of a fast-paced
environment in a hyper-growth company.
- A joy to work with

Sounds like you ? Let’s get in
touch!


#Li-hybrid
#Li-remote

lists.content:
• Co-design the processes and infrastructure used by Data Scientists to carry out experiments and run workflows in production
  • Ensure those elements of architecture work in harmony with the Data Platform used by all the Data teams
  • Share your knowledge and evangelize
  • Own the whole project from identifying the needs with Data Scientists to carrying out a POC and actually creating and operating the infrastructure
  • Collaborate closely with Data Scientists and SREs to iterate on the infrastructure

• 4+ years experience in Data
  • English proficient (verbal and written)
  • Track-record of creating and operating Machine Learning systems 
  • Understanding of the daily life of a Data Scientist
  • Knowledge of Cloud Technologies, Infra-As-Code, Containerization, CI/CD
  • Knowledge of MLOps best-practices
  • Capacity to design and implement architecture
  • Proficiency with Python
  • Proactivity, empathy, ability to defend ideas and share knowledge
  • Ability to discuss with people that have diverse skills and challenges (Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Site Reliability Engineers)

• Experience with ML tools and frameworks such as KubeFlow / MLFlow / MetaFlow / SageMaker
  • Knowledge of Airflow or similar orchestrators / observability tools
  • French proficiency (at least B2)

• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere

Management, check and preparation of social benefits, bonus, variable compensation,leaves in general (sick leave, maternity, holidays…)
Management of the new comers and the leavers in terms of Payroll
Be the point of contact & assisting employees on a daily basis with their questions about their payslips (health insurance, paid holidays, transport, meal voucher etc.)
Give support to the HR Admin & Payroll Lead based in France for UK & Germany’s payroll (5 employees) with our External Provider

ADMINISTRATION

Give a support to the HR Admin Manager Spain for :

Participating in HR reporting (KPI)
Coordinating the onboarding and outboarding’s employees processes 
Accompanying employees from their entry to their departure (drafting of the employment contract, amendment, etc.)
Managing the Internal Mobilities, in Spain and between the differents areas (Spain <> France)

lists.content:
• 5+ years experience required
  • Solid knowledge of Spanish Payroll,Social contributions & tax calculations, Knowledge of SAP/Succesfactor is a plus
  • Solid knowledge in HR (administration ...), 
  • Writing skills,Organizational skills, time management and priorities.
  • Ensure a good flow of information within the various departments  
  • Know how to convey the message you want to put across (precision, clarity, conciseness)    
  • Ensure that the confidentiality of HR information is respected
  • English and Spanish fluent, French is a plus

descriptionPlain:
Launched
    in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
    together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
    products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany,
    United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24
    nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s
    culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business
    adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects
    on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Product organization at
    ManoMano is divided into 5 Gears (Mega-Tribe)
SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their
    business (main KPI: seller revenues)
COMMERCE: Help customer discover what they need (Main KPI : add to cart
    rate)
PROJECT & SERVICES: Help the customer to set up his own project with advice. We will propose some new
    services dedicated to DIY 
BUYERS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring buying (main KPI: NPS and Funnel
    Conversion Rate)
BtoB: Transform the DIY marketplace to help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main
    KPI: B2B repurchase rate)

Each tribe includes several Feature Teams (FTs) gathered within Groups (small entities
    of up to 4 FTs).

→ The open position of Senior Product Manager - DIY Content is in the Project & Services
    tribe.

Missions 

Our mission at ManoMano is to invent a differentiating and humanized home-improvement
    experience, including inspiration, planning and shopping to help customers pursue their projects.

As Senior
    Product Manager of DIY CONTENT FT, you will play a main role to help MM achieve this vision:

- Understand MM
    visitors DYI pain points , in partnership with category managers, content creators & user-researchers
- Discover &
    design new customer-friendly advice formats : pictures, videos, stories, other.
- Improve our content
    discoverability to visitors thanks to relevant customer journeys
- Leverage our communities (UGC content, power
    customers, Manodvisor) and find the best combination in content sources to match visitor’s expectations &
    needs

Main features identified so far in 2022:
- In listing advice
- Best products page
- CMS
- New Advice
    touchpoints

North star metric:
- Average number of items purchased per customer over 90 days on covered
    categories


Expected profile
- You thrive in a startup environment growing (fast).
- You handle ambiguity,
    complexity, and interdependencies in an organized, prioritized, and structured way. 
- You have excellent judgment
    and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem. 
- You are passionate about it.
- You have great
    communication skills and intuition for communication strategy at every level.
- We often say about you that you are
    an analytical and “customer-centric” person. 
- You believe that data should help drive your product strategy.
-
    You are kind, thoughtful, and have a natural ability to get things done. You qualify as an “achiever”.
- Your
    English (and French) is perfect.

Bonus points:
You love DIY and want to profoundly play a role in the
    reinvention of this market

Interview Process
1/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
2/ In-Person interview
    with the Head of Product (hiring manager)
3/ In-Person interview with the IT Lead
4/ In-Person interview with the
    VP Product

#LI-Remote, #LI-Hybrid

descriptionPlain:
Launched
    in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
    together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
    products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany,
    United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24
    nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s
    culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business
    adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects
    on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Product organization at
    ManoMano is divided into 5 Gears (Mega-Tribe)
SELLERS: Provide the best experience to our sellers to grow their
    business (main KPI: seller revenues)
COMMERCE: Help customer discover what they need (Main KPI : add to cart
    rate)
PROJECT & SERVICES: Help the customer to set up his own project with advice. We will propose some new
    services dedicated to DIY 
BUYERS: Offer the most seamless and reassuring buying (main KPI: NPS and Funnel
    Conversion Rate)
BtoB: Transform the DIY marketplace to help construction entrepreneur to run their business (main
    KPI: B2B repurchase rate)

Each tribe includes several Feature Teams (FTs) gathered within Groups (small entities
    of up to 4 FTs).

→ The open position of Senior Product Manager - Financial Flows is in the Buyers tribe.

Your
    Product Management role at ManoMano

As Product Owner for Financial Flows (Funds Allocation), you will be
    responsible for the modular platform to track and assign money. Marketplaces like ManoMano facilitate a transaction
    between a buyer and seller and, therefore, need to keep track of every cent received, earned and paid to our
    sellers. You will be at the center of the Financial action building the new orchestration layer that will track and
    split the money between buyers, sellers, tax authorities and commissions. To give you an idea of the volume, in
    2020, we processed more than 1,2B€. 

The role reports to the Head of Product - Payments & Finance. Your future
    manager has more than 15 years of experience in e-commerce and Payments and will coach you in your journey to become
    a great Product Manager. Additionally, your future manager is passionate about diversity and inclusion and
    appreciates people from different backgrounds and cultures. 

Your main missions will consist in 
1- Product
    discovery
Master the problem space of your feature team through a deep knowledge of your sellers’ pain points and
    needs through qualitative research (assisted by our user research department), quantitative data (NPS results,
    tailored surveys) or understanding regulatory frameworks (in partnership with our Legal, Compliance and Finance
    teams) and financial flows. 

2- Product strategy
- Build and nurture the product vision based on the data you
    gathered (from users, your team, data analysis, competitors, user research, regulatory frameworks, financial
    flows…)
- Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap, following our quarterly planning process. You will
    make sure that we’re building the right features
- Make sure your team / stakeholders understand and embrace it
    through your engaging communication 
- Integrate your product strategy within the company strategy

3- Product
    delivery
- Ensure the correct delivery of your feature team (pace of delivery, quality of delivery). Animate demos
    of your team to foster a continuous improvement culture. Verify the traceability of the financial flows thanks to
    data and insights from Payments and Finance teams. 
- Be obsessed by the impact of the features you ship through
    A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate insights about your product (with user researchers’ help)
-
    Communicate in a timely manner with your Head of Product about important information, alerts, etc. Ask for help
    everytime you need it, and be a fast learner

Expected profile
- The role is all about tracking money with great
    accuracy: we are looking for someone who can pay rigorous attention to financial flows. 
- You understand the
    principles of a double-entry bookkeeping system and know how to use a ledger for money tracking.
- You are familiar
    with European regulations, notably PSD2 (Revised Payment Services Directive), GDPR, AML (Anti-money laundering) and,
    VAT regulations for digital marketplaces. 
- You have excellent communication skills and intuition to adapt your
    message according to your audience. 
- You are comfortable working and communicating with Engineers and you are
    willing to learn more, particularly about integration with Payment Service Providers or other Financial Providers.
    
- You are comfortable with a fast-growing scaleup, which means you can adapt quickly, see the big picture, pay
    attention to details and you can find ingenious ways to maximize resources. 
- You have developed empathy to
    understand customers or business partners and ask the right questions to discover the underlying problem.
- You are
    comfortable handling large datasets (in Excel, SQL or something more advanced, the choice is yours but you know how
    to get insights from millions of records). You believe that data should help drive your product strategy. You can
    prove your hypothesis through data points.
- You are kind, thoughtful and have developed an ability to get things
    done.
- If your mother tongue is French, your English CEFR level is at least B1. Else, your French CEFR level is,
    at minimum, B2.

Bonus points:
- Your background is in Finance, Economics, Actuary, FP&A, Budget, Accounting or
    any other field where you have to follow a rigorous methodology to keep track of money and you can prove it. 
- You
    have worked in a FinTech company, either a Payment Service Provider, a card network, a bank, investment firm or
    consulting working in financial projects. 
- You have already worked in an e-commerce company, started your own
    company or experienced the marketplace model as a seller for several years. 
- You enjoy DIY, gardening or home
    improvement and want to profoundly play a role in the reinvention of this market.

It is OK to apply without
    meeting all the requirements, just tell us why you are the right candidate, what is your motivation and what would
    you need to be successful. 

Interview Process
1/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
2/ In-Person interview
    with the Head of Product (hiring manager)
3/ In-Person interview with the Head of Payments
4/ In-Person interview
    with the IT Lead
5/ In-Person interview with the Head of FP&A

Product Management role at ManoMano : 

As a Senior Product Manager - Logistics,
    you will be responsible to provide the best tools to our logistics teams in order to improve warehouse operations
    (Inbound / Outbound) and support the growth of our european logistic network.
The role reports to the Group PM -
    Delivery XP.

Your main missions will consist in : 

1- Product discovery
- Master the problem space of your
    feature team through a deep knowledge of your users pain points and needs through qualitative research (assisted by
    our user research department) or quantitative data (NPS results, Customer Effort Score verbatims)

2- Product
    strategy
- Build and nurture the product vision, based on the data you gathered (from users, your team, data
    analysis, competitors, user research…)
- Turn that into a strategy and a well-thought roadmap: you will make sure
    that we’re building the right features
- Make sure your team / stakeholders understand and embrace it through your
    engaging communication 
- Integrate your group product strategy within the company strategy

3- Product
    delivery
- Ensure the correct delivery of your feature team (pace of delivery, quality of delivery) Animate demos
    of your team to foster a continuous improvement culture
- Be obsessed by the impact of the features you ship
    through A/B testing, behavior data, etc. and generate insights about your product (with user researchers’ help)
-
    Communicate in a timely manner with your Group PM and Product Director about important information, alerts, etc. Ask
    for help everytime you need it, and be a fast learner

Expected profile
- You have a doer mindset and an
    Engineering or Business School degree. You thrive in a startup environment growing (fast). 
- You have worked on
    products with a high volume of users.
- You have intuition and empathy, towards the users of your features, towards
    your colleagues.
- You handle ambiguity, complexity and interdependencies in an organized, prioritized and
    structured way. You have excellent judgment and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem. You are
    passionate about it. 
- You have great communication skills
- We often say about you that you’re an analytical and
    “customer centric” person. You believe that data should help drive your product strategy.
- You are kind,
    thoughtful and have a natural ability to get things done. You qualify as an “achiever”. 
- You proved to be a
    successful PM on a single Feature Team and you managed to leverage your FT do most of the operational job of the
    Scrum process.
- Your English is perfect.

It could be a plus if :
- You have already worked in an ecommerce
    company, started your own company or know at least the marketplace/platform model
- You love DIY and want to
    profoundly play a role in the reinvention of this marketInterview

Process :

1/ Phone interview with a Talent
    Recruiter
2/ In-Person interview with a Group PM
3/ In-Person interview with IT Lead
4/ In-Person interview with
    a Product Director

#LI-Remote, #LI-Hybrid

descriptionPlain:
Launched in
    2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings
    together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million
    products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany,
    United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24
    nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s
    culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business
    adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects
    on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoMano wants to offer an
    exceptional customer experience (CX) and be a leader in this field. For this, as a trusted intermediary, ManoMano
    must manage the quality of service offered by its sellers (mainly, but not only, on delivery efficiency and
    after-sales service).The Sellers Operations Excellence Team is dedicated to ensuring a top of class CX is offered to
    all ManoMano customers by our sellers. 
 
Directly reporting to the Seller Operations Excellence Lead, your role
    is to ensure that our 4,000+ EU and Worldwide sellers are offering a seamless & top of the art experience to our
    customers in all our platforms in Europe. Your key responsibility is to make sure they have the relevant data, tools
    and support at their service to operate in full autonomy while delivering a perfect experience to our ManoMano
    customers. 

You will also work closely with account managers, seller support and tech teams to define sellers’
    needs in terms of training, education, new features and bring seller’s Quality to the next level.

In particular,
    you will have the following missions:
- Build end-to-end projects (from roadmap definition to implementation) with
    our product team to provide our community of sellers with the tools & data to improve their operations, including a
    centralized Ops Control center in their ManoMano Orders management system;
- Build autonomy / education programmes
    for specific category of sellers (worldwide sellers) that are not used to dealing with European customers habits and
    expectations;
- Define the ManoMano strategy on Sellers' Education & Training all along their lifecycle at ManoMano
    (first onboarding on ManoMano, onboarding on new countries, switch to our logistics service...) always aiming at
    making our sellers fully autonomous (MOOC approach, Gaming Badges, Sellers’ community support,..);
- Build and
    maintain innovative training materials and support content (FAQ,..) on our operations quality standards, tools
    guide, both for our sellers, and for internal account managers to allow them to provide the best support to their
    sellers. 

Profile required:
- You have proven experiences of project management, ideally in a fast evolving
    environment
- You are attracted by e-commerce, new technologies and are very interested in customer experience
-
    You are a fast-learner, hands on and you don’t mind to go out of the original scope of your responsibilities to
    achieve your objectives
- You have empathy and the ability to put yourself in “Customers shoes” and “Sellers shoes”
    
- You are a wonderful team player and know how to involve many stakeholders in your projects and make them feel
    committed
- You are rigorous and demanding towards yourself and others
- You think outside the box to always
    propose innovative ideas even on the simplest things

Competencies: 
- You have proven analytical capabilities
    
- You are familiar with project management tools and processes - knowledge about Agile/Scrum approach is a plu
-
    You master Excel and have ideally SQL notions
- You speak English and French bilingual, another ManoMano language
    spoken (Italian, Spanish or German) is a plus

    link between Seller Partnership’s Leaders and their stakeholders focused on the SAM program. As a Program Manager,

    various transversal teams and leadership. The SAM program is strategic for ManoMano development and will be key to

description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

The Senior Program Manager will be the key link between Seller Partnership’s Leaders and their stakeholders focused on the SAM program. As a Program Manager, you will be responsible to launch the program and drive solutions by building collaborative relationships with various transversal teams and leadership. The SAM program is strategic for ManoMano development and will be key to redefine the role of the sellers account managers, the internal organisation and processes, by testing and iterating. In the context of hypergrowth, we need to continously have a greater impact for our sellers and in our team.

lists.content:
• Lead the SAM program :

  • Creating goals and related metrics, track progress and manage through obstacles to achieve your objectives,

  • Ensure visibility & tracking of the project’s advancement,

  • Gain support for your strategy and roadmap from stakeholders by writing narratives and influencing peers and senior leadership,

  • Dive deep on issues and come up with solutions, working with product teams for long-term implementation,

  • Addressing barriers through problem solving and coordination with stakeholders,

  • Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make trade-offs and balance the business needs versus technical constraint, 

  • Identify gaps and pain points in the existing processes and drive improvements,

  • Identify and analyze to isolate issues, test solutions and prioritize competing program opportunities,

  • Conceptualize and drive program changes,

  • Challenge the project management framework in line with the company one.

• Possess a strong business and analysis background, preferably from a top consultancy related to retail, and technology, and/or in-house in a strategy or business planning role at a leading related company,

  • Have a natural aptitude for translating data into insights, and the ability to define and influence new strategies based on these insights,

  • Manage stakeholders well, able to quickly build relationships and credibility, to collaborate with and advise others, and to navigate an organisation to make things happen,

  • Have the ability to solve complex, cross-functional business problems while dealing with challenging deadlines and opposing priorities,

  • Be flexible and adaptable to manage varying demands of a fast paced business, with a hands-on attitude and attention to the finest of detail,

  • Have strong quantitative analysis skills and proficiency in spreadsheet applications,

  • Have outstanding written and verbal communication and presentation skills,

  • Knowledge or eagerness to learn SQL is a plus,

  • University degree, MBA or Post-Graduate is a plus,

  • Several years of relevant experience in consultancy, strategy or Project management roles,

  • A thorough understanding of online & offline retail industry and technology companies,

  • A proven successful project management track record,

  • Fluent English is required. Additional languages are valued, especially French, German, Spanish or Italian,

  • This role reports to the Lead Program Manager of Seller Partnerships & New Services teams.

• Fast growing start-up environment
  • International & agile company 
  • Possible full remote
  • Sponsorings to external conferences - organisation of internal and external Meetups
  • DIY workshops and internal events
  • Amazing work environment in Paris 17th, Barcelona & Bordeaux
  • 7 weeks holidays/year
  • Tickets restaurant

As a Scrum Master you will be involved in:

Responsibilities

· SM Tribe is
    responsible to maintain and improve Scrum process and efficiency for a specific tribe (3 to 5 ft's)
· Act as a
    facilitator to improve the efficiency of the Tribe
· Can take the role of SM in feature teams* Improve and use
    Agility KPI to monitor tribe efficiency
· Mentor Scrum Master Dev
· Escalate issues and best practices to Global
    level
· Facilitate workshop around team building, scrum knowledge and empowerment...
· Work from our office in
    Barcelona or remotly

Requirements

· Minimum 1 year of experience on Scrum Mastering 
· You excel at
    facilitating and mentoring teams towards rapidly delivering high impact, high quality software in a sustainable
    fashion
· You listen and observe before acting
· Success of the team is your goal 
· You have a deep
    understanding of communication, group dynamics and are able to help teams develop trust and safety* You have an
    understanding and experience with Scrum
· You are able to adapt your approach and communication style to fit
    varying contexts and situational needs
· You are not afraid to raise issues and inspire change and continuous
    improvement
· You care about learning new things and improving upon existing challenges
· You are comfortable with
    and can help guide others to deal with situations of conflict, ambiguity, and uncertainty
· Good level of
    English

· You have a deep understanding of communication, group dynamics and are able to help teams develop trust and safety* You have an understanding and experience with Scrum
· You are able to adapt your approach and communication style to fit varying contexts and situational needs
· You are not afraid to raise issues and inspire change and continuous improvement
· You care about learning new things and improving upon existing challenges
· You are comfortable with and can help guide others to deal with situations of conflict, ambiguity, and uncertainty
· Good level of English

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised
    in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
    products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer
    across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos,
    including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and
    Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and
    care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
    to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
    https://medium.com/manomano-tech

To consolidate its position as DIY and Gardening online leader, ManoMano has put
    technology at the heart of its strategy.
We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering qualitatives products that we
    will be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionise their online DIY
    experience.
 
As a fast growing company, we are always on the look for ingenious and passionate people.


The
    Agile team mission is to support, train, and coach teams to reach a state of high-performance and self-organized
    teams.
To do so, the agile team consist in 3 roles:
- Scrum Master focus on team efficiency
- Agile Coach focus
    on people skills and autonomy
- Delivery Manager focus on synchronization to assure features delivery - Delivery
    Manager intervenes in a Program context when an objective requires multiple feature teams to work
    together.


MAIN CHALLENGES

As Senior Scrum Master you will
- Make sure that all teams reach their
    objectives
- finds the right balance between team autonomy and doing things by yourself
- work on a scope between
    3/5 teams all in the same tribe
- follow any Scrum, ScrumBan, Kanban approach to reach his challenge - keeping on
    mind that Scrum methodology is our default methodology
- be accountable for teams' release plan efficiency reaching
    their objectives
- work closely with IT Lead and Product Manager of each team.

MAIN ACTIVITIES

Methodology
-
    Senior Scrum Master is responsible to maintain and improve Scrum process and efficiency on a specific scope (3 to 5
    ft's)
- Can take the role of SM in teams or delegate it
- Assure teams workflow efficiency
- Facilitate workshops
    around team building, scrum knowledge and empowerment…
- Can facilitate agile@scale events

Continuous
    improvement 
- Mentor Scrum Master
- Escalate issues and best practices to tribe level
- Improve and use Agility
    KPI to monitor tribe efficiency
- Spread ManoMano Agile framework via teaching and mentorin

Communication
-
    Responsible for release plan synchronization inside/outside the teams 
- Act as a facilitator to improve the
    efficiency of the Tribe
- Keep release plan and teams Jira board up to date
- Share dependencies progress and
    impact with concerned other teams

lists.text: What we can offer you at ManoMano
lists.content:
• People: Smart/ diverse backgrounds / international environment/ A positive, supportive & dynamic atmosphere

  • MM employee discount

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European
    leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY
    & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
    the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are
    850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices
    (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
    boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and
    (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a
    look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, your missions will be
    to contribute to build and operate systems :

- Implement the tools and processes of deployment and
    industrialization that ensure the sustainability working of web applications, track the evolution of these
    applications over time. Be a strong stakeholder of building a platform-on-demand.
- Help the development teams and
    provide them support to facilitate regular production releases and optimize delivery processes.
- Investigate and
    check systems, analyze and resolve performance and scalability issues.
- Contribute to SRE projects with autonomy
    and efficiency,
- Help teams and teammates deliver projects, guide them to apply best practises and coach more
    juniors SRE


Which skills we expect :
Soft skills : 
 - Be Bold, Ingenious & Carefull
 - Good sense of
    service
 - Ability to coach juniors SRE (onboarding, day to day)
 - Autonomous 
 - Be able to handle complex
    issues

Hard skills : 
 - Strong knowledge in operating systems, network, production, automation (infra-as-code),
    observability tools and Cloud technologies
 - Knowledge in infrastructure design and implementation (architecture)
    :
		- Knowledge of MicroServices Architecture
		- Knowledge about the AWS public cloud
 - Good knowledge on
    OS and network 
 - Development skills in infra automation language (Go, Python,Terraform,...)
 - Technologies
    knowledge requirements :
		- Systems & Software: Debian, Docker, Kubernetes, nginx, Redis, Mesh : Consul & Envoy
    is a plus
		- DB : MariaDB,PostgreSql / Knowledge of MongoDB is a plus
		- Event system : RabbitMQ and
    knowledge of Kafka would be appreciated
		- Monitoring management skills
		- Automation: Ansible, Terraform,
    Packer, Knowledge of a CI system 

Others
- 5+ year experience in web 
- Fluent in English (verbal and written),
    French and Spanish are a plus
- Good understanding of ops technologies

We do in ManoMano :
- Software
    craftsmanship: clean code, testing, peer programming, code review…
- Devops: CI/CD, observability…
-
    Language/Framework : React, PHP/Symfony, Java, Kotlin, SpringBoot, Gradle, Quarkus, Python, Go, NodeJS, Kafka,
    RabbitMQ, …
- Tools : Google Workspace, Slack, Confluence, Draw.io, Miro, JIRA…
- Monitoring :
    Datadog

Work: office/ hybrid/ full remote  (This role is remote-eligible from Spain)
Salary: competitive salary package
Technology: Get a laptop you love to do your best work
Time off: 30 days of paid vacation
Flexibility: Flexible working hours including Friday afternoons off.
Sports: free gym membership
Healthcare: Private Health Insurance. 
Retreats/ fun: music room/ a terrace/ modern office/  Crafternoons every Thursday afternoon (share your knowledge, learn from others)/ External events attendance, fairs & Meetups
Food: Ticket Restaurant (flexible remuneration)
Transportation: Ticket transportation (flexible remuneration)
MM employee discount

We're actively seeking applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

If all the above rings a bell, it probably means that we are meant to meet each other ! Please get in touch.« So, come and plant the seeds of your success and gather the fruits of your labour »

The information collected on this form is recorded in a file used by ManoMano - Colibri SAS so that we can process your application.   
The data is kept for 2 years from the date of your application. You can access your data, rectify it, request its deletion or exercise your right to limit the processing of your data. You can also exercise your right to the portability of your data. Consult the cnil.fr website for more information on your rights. 
To exercise these rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data under this scheme, you can contact our data protection officer by writing to dpo@manomano.com.  
If, after having contacted us, you feel that your "Data Protection" rights have not been respected, you may submit a complaint to the CNIL.

• Subject Matter Expert responsible for helping ManoMano to be the best in class actor on the market for all Talent Acquisition practices and help hire the best tech candidates

  • Responsible for a large scope of tech strategic recruitments

  • In charge of the full recruitment process cycle maintaining the ManoMano excellence (from brief with hiring managers, hunting, interviewing to extension of offer to candidates):
  • Act as a Business Partner with all Hiring Managers and HRBPs
  • Train them on ManoMano recruitment best practices
  • Advice/Exchange/Challenge on the tech recruitment strategy (timeline, recruitment channels, recruitment process, manage expectations/vs business needs)
  • Work hand in hand with tech HRBPs (offers, departures, organisational issues)
  • Follow up and management of all data related to recruitment:
  • Recruitment dashboards and Creation of ad hoc reports
  • Follow up of budget (levels, respect of the recruitment plan budget)
  • Make sure Salary packages are competitive, attractive and respect internal equity and guidelines)
  • KPIs (improve time to fill and to hire, achieve monthly targets)
  • Responsible for making ManoMano shine internally and externally and be a Premium Ambassador of the company
  • Employer Branding
  • Campus Management
  • Hire by our values and represent our values
  • Owner of specific projects related to Talent Acquisition to help improve our processes

• Bachelor’s degree required in business or psychology or related field applicable to HR

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in
    DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online
    products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer
    across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos,
    including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and
    Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and
    care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment
    to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog :
    https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Context
The Experience Design team is part of the Tech department at ManoMano,
    together with Product and IT teams.
Currently, almost 15 designers and user researchers are working together in
    order to design and deliver best-in-class products & services to our users & customers, and support business growth
    ambitions.

We are looking for a Senior UX/UI designer to join the Experience Design team and work on our BtC
    e-commerce platform.
The ideal candidate will have proven experience expanding, leading, and implementing UX vision
    in order to design and build memorable experiences.. Additionally, the candidate will possess an exceptional ability
    to collaborate across large teams and pitch/evangelize ideas as part of a larger-scale creative framework.

This
    role reports to the Senior Lead UX of the Tribe.

As Senior UX/UI Designer you will
- Frame and solve problems
    weaving together experiences that take the user needs, business goals and technology into account
- Start with
    user! Leverage what we learn from our user researches and turn those insights into best-in-class user experiences
-
    Drive your own product discovery including Product Managers in order to understand your users pain points by
    collecting users’ feedbacks (qualitative research) and putting it together with datas
- Distill ideas, clearly
    communicate and articulate the “why” of design decisions in order to influence your stakeholders and build
    consensus
- Inspire and align the team around user experience by developing user flows and interfaces informed by
    user interactions and product requirements
- Work closely with the Features Teams that are in your scope, meaning
    Product Managers, engineers and also Business Owners in order to get buy-in and alignment on your design
    recommendations
- Spread a user-centric mindset through impactful design methodologies and regular sessions with
    users. 
- Collaborate with designers and developers to maintain design consistency and coherence across our product
    ecosystem.

Requirements
- 5+ years of experience as a Product Designer, UX designer or similar role, working on
    consumer-facing and BtC websites.
- A demonstrated ability to communicate UX pitches and to get alignment from
    internal stakeholders.
- Experience conducting co-design sessions with users and managing asynchronous user
    tests.
- A great ability to conceptualize and implement UX concepts
- Deep familiarity with UX principles,
    methodologies and best practices including user-centered approaches.
- Extensive knowledge and experience designing
    in Figma, Sketch, InVision and Adobe Suite.
- An understanding or previous experience designing/working with Design
    Systems
- An understanding of how design impacts development and a knack for constructing delightful designs that
    are technically feasible.

More about you
- Full of empathy for users
- Positive attitude and an ability to
    receive and provide objective feedback
- Self-motivated, collaborative, excellent interpersonal and communication
    skills
- A self-starter who’s passionate and thoughtful about her/his work
- Ability to challenge the status quo
    and envision innovative solutions
- Eager to be part of a fast-paced environment in a hyper-growth company.
- A
    joy to work with


#Li-Remote

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the
    European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest
    offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano
    brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.
    

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working
    in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core
    values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an
    ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.

    
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Joining a newly created team, your position involves
    to work on a variety of aspectq of payment and money. The team drives different projects around payment methods,
    payment platform, funds out and funds allocations.
The Money feature team's mission is to build the solutions to
    garantee safe transactions for the users of our website.

By joining this feature team you will have a unique
    opportunity to work on large scale projects with a critical business impact!


Context
- Tech team composed of
    300+ engineers
- Agile mindset since the birth of ManoMano: Scrum and SAFe is widely applied
- 3 offices (Paris,
    Bordeaux and Barcelona) with up to 100% remote
- Our working language is mostly in english. We are using French as
    well, and some of us talks Spanish/German/Italian...


Main Responsabilities 

- Understand the technical
    solutions, build and deliver them, respecting the sprint’s deadlines. 
- Participate in the daily activities of the
    team.
- Keep on growing as a Software Engineer.
- Learn backend, queuing systems, databases, financial movements,
    monitoring & performances using Datadog.
- Involve yourself in the MM Java community. 


Technical stack 
-
    Microservices in Spring Boot and Java 11 (soon 17)
- Architecture inspired from the Hexagonal and Clean
    Architecture
- PostgreSQL, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Redis
- Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
- Gitlab CI/CD
- Datadog,
    Sentry, Slack, Jira


Requirements
- 3+ years of experience as a backend engineer
- Mastery of the language
    Java (SpringBoot) & Rest API
- Strong knowledge of PostGreSQL & MySQL databases
- A first experience with cloud
    technologies, AWS prefered
- An experience with RabbitMQ, Kafka, Docker or Kubernetes would be a plus
- Be lazy,
    automate things in order to helps us be more scalable and efficient
- Fluent in english
- Able to work in a fast
    changing (and not perfect) environment
- Taste for continuous improvement, with a strong desire to test, experiment
    and share better solutions

    microservices to design & develop new featuresBuild a robust monitoring to get an efficient alertingLearn to grow

description:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online.  ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

We currently are 850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values : boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

ManoMano, already positioned as the European leader in DIY, wants to propose the best online experience in DIY ecommerce. Our company is growing fast and wants to structure its teams. We are looking for a Software Engineer - JAVA  in Bordeaux, Paris or Remote to join our feature team on the Logistics perimeter.

The Mano Fulfillment team 📦 helps handle the logistics of ManoMano’s sellers. We provide for them the service of handling the delivery of their products.

Some of our features :
- The shipment of orders from the warehouses
- The stocks management of products
- The sellers’ invoicing for using our fulfillment systemand many more...Being part of the team will help you learn the importance of logistics in today’s world  

 Responsibilities :
You will join a team, in order to create, in collaboration with the product and UX / UI teams, an amazing experience for the merchants and the customers.

As a Sofware Engineer - JAVA  you will Be fully integrated in the fabulous team in charge of LogisticsWork on SpringBoot microservices to design & develop new featuresBuild a robust monitoring to get an efficient alertingLearn to grow you soft & hard skills every quarter

At ManoMano we love and aspire to :
- Push often and serenely to production
- Software craftsmanship: clean code, testing, peer programming, code review…
- Monitor code and functionalities (mistakes, product metrics)
- Take advantage of containers flexibility (docker)
- Leverage cloud scalability (AWS)
- Migrate to micro-services and event-based architectures
- Cultivating CI / CD and Agility  

Technical stack :
- MicroservicesLangages : Java 11, Kotlin
- Build tool : Gradle
- Main framework (IoC) : Spring boot 2, Apache CamelORM & data : Hibernate, Liquibase
- Testing : JUnit 5, Mockito
- Communication : REST API, RabbitMQ, Kafka
- Cache : RedisCloud : AWS 

Requirements :
- 1 year of experience in the Java ecosystem ☕
- You already worked with most of our technical stack 🛠️
- Soul of a doer, like to take initiatives and offer new solutions 💡
- Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment) 🏃
- Team spirit and good communication skills 👥
- Positive mindset 😃Good level in english 🇬🇧


Process Interview :
- ProcessPhone interview with a Talent Recruiter
- Zoom interview with an Engineering Lead and 1 member of the team
- Zoom interview with an Engineering Manager
text:
Software Engineer - JAVA [Logistics] - Full remote
    in
    France

additionalPlain:
The
    Marketplace Finance feature team is responsible for all activities related to the payment of our sellers :
    marketplace invoices, payment of their sales, financial reports and seller payment backoffice. Our goal is to
    provide the best seller experience related to the management of their financial flow with ManoMano.

We are also
    responsible for the VAT liability process. T
oday we process all orders at Manomano and evaluate them in accordance
    with European and UK rules.
Your challenge as a Staff Java Backend Engineer will be to work on existing
    microservices and creating new ones, ensuring a good level of architecture, scalability, robustness, consistency and
    performance required by using concepts such as idempotency, distributed services, reactive architecture, back
    pressure and more to guarantee a quality of seller finance service and vat services for years to
    come.

CONTEXT

25 feature teams in January 2021 and expect to grow x2 in next year
Agile mindset is there
    since the birth of ManoMano
Main default method is Scrum within 2 weeks iteration
3 offices: Paris, Bordeaux and
    Barcelona
Language for writing is English; speaking is english by default or french, spanish, german...

MAIN
    ACTIVITIES

You will join a team, composed of 4 Developers + 1 staff + 1 Lead + 1 Product Manager, in order to
    create an amazing experience for our sellers and our accounting department.
As a Staff Software Engineer you will
    be the right-hand of the Engineering Lead and you will be a key member of the team.

Your role will be to :
-
    Assimilate business and marketplace finance context
- Provide advices on the Finance technical architecture
- Be a
    driver on our technological choices, provide advices and recommendations
- Share your experience with other team
    members with pair programming, review, and technical feature definition
- Help us to improve our global quality,
    with tests, monitoring, craftsman practices and monitoring.
- Help our developer community to growth and shine 
-
    Participate in the development of our future features

TECHNICAL STACK :

Microservices inspired by hexagonal
    architecture
Java 11 soon 17 
Kotlin
Spring Boot 2
MySQL, Postgre
RabbitMQ
Kafka soon
Gitlab &
    CI/CD
Docker
AWS EKS / Kubernetes
DAILY WORK TOOLS :
jira /
    confluence
slack
zoom
miro
draw.io

REQUIREMENTS
Technical skills :
+7 years of experience as a Backend
    Developer
High understanding of Micro-service Architecture: DDD, SOLID, Distributed Systems architecture.
You
    already worked with most of our technical stack
Unit Testing, Acceptance Testing, Integration Testing, Load,
    Testing, Contract Testing
Creative / Innovative
Knowledge in Monitoring, Alerting
Ability to design new systems
    and features
Software Craftsmanship
 
Soft skills :
Soul of a doer, like to take initiatives and offer new
    solutions
Autonomous and adaptable (able to work in a constantly changing environment)
Team spirit and excellent
    interpersonal skills
Curious with a strong desire to test and experiment new solutions in your work
Fluent in
    english

INTERVIEW PROCESS :

1/ Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter
+ Technical Test (CodinGame)
2/ Zoom
    interview with a Team Lead + Software Engineer
3/ Final Zoom interview with an Engineering Manager or VP
    Engineer



We're actively seeking applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

If all the above rings a
    bell, it probably means that we are meant to meet each other ! Please get in touch.« So, come and plant the seeds of
    your success and gather the fruits of your labour »

The information collected on this form is recorded in a file
    used by ManoMano - Colibri SAS so that we can process your application. 
The data is kept for 2 years from the date
    of your application. You can access your data, rectify it, request its deletion or exercise your right to limit the
    processing of your data. You can also exercise your right to the portability of your data. Consult the cnil.fr
    website for more information on your rights. 
To exercise these rights or if you have any questions about the
    processing of your data under this scheme, you can contact our data protection officer by writing to
    dpo@manomano.com. 
If, after having contacted us, you feel that your "Data Protection" rights have not been
    respected, you may submit a complaint to the CNIL.

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European
    leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY
    & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
    the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are
    850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices
    (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
    boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and
    (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a
    look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

To consolidate its position as DIY and Gardening online
    leader, ManoMano has put technology at the heart of its strategy. We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering high
    quality products that we will be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionize
    their online DIY experience.

At ManoMano, we don’t have a Quality Assurance team anymore. Instead, we created the
    QRAFT team, focusing on continuous quality improvement and Software Craftsmanship. Our mission is to empower other
    Tech teams in their Operational Excellence, because our goals are to:

- Protect ManoMano’s business from
    degradation
- Increase that quality of ManoMano websites and apps as perceived by our users
- Optimize
    time-to-market in a sustainable and scalable way

About you:

As a Staff Quality Advisor:
- You have tactful
    yet determined communication
- Your approach of software engineering is agile (not Agile™️)
- Change management at
    organizational level is a piece of cake for you
- You know that BDD is not a testing framework
- You know that
    Quality is not another name for Testing
- You know that the Test Pyramid has nothing to do with
    Egyptology

Typical activities (non-exhaustive list) : 
- Train and coach development teams so they fully own the
    quality of their product
- Define and coordinate the quality strategy on cross-teams, larger-scale initiatives
-
    Make sure teams have easy access to key quality indicators
- Give talks inside (and even outside) ManoMano
-
    Mentor other Quality Advisors
- Work with DX (Developer eXperience team) to rollout new practices and tools
-
    Challenge and optimize processes with the Lead QA

Technical skills:

- 6+ years relevant experience in QA roles
    working as part of a wider development team, pairing with Devs, Product Manager, SRE, Designers and other relevant
    stakeholders
- Solid understanding of agile development principles
- Embracing the devops mindset, shifting the
    testing effort to the left and other relevant modern techniques, while having experience applying them in real
    projects
- Experience with Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) and Three Amigos / Example Mapping
- Understanding
    of distributed architecture, RESTful APIs
- Working experience with CI/CD

Interpersonal skills:

- Did we
    mention communication is important? We want to bring a Quality Culture across the entire organization, so yes
    communication IS important.
- Ingenious, creative, humble and curious with a big appetite to learn, discover and
    experiment new things: we always question the status quo
- Autonomous and adaptable: you know what working in a
    fast-changing environment means
- You are a good team player: one player wins matches, the team wins trophies
-
    You have a problem solver mindset: we face new challenges every day
- You are comfortable communicating in English:
    we are people from diverse nationalities, so it’s our company's official language

Bonus points

- Experience
    with a programming language
- Previous experience working in an e-commerce
- You keep up-to-date with the QA
    industry’s best practices, tools and techniques
- You are contributing to conferences, meetups, articles…

Our
    current tech stack :

- Microservice architecture in the cloud with AWS, Kubernetes (check out our blog)
-
    JavaScript (NextJS, React Native), Java, Kotlin, GolangJira and Xray for test scenario management
- CodeceptJS,
    Detox, Webdriver for GUI testing
- Postman, Newman and CodeceptJS, Behat, PACT for API testing
- Gitlab / Bitrise
    / Bitbar for our CI/CD/CT together with Sonarqube for Code quality
- And more... including an in-house defect
    management system!

- You are a good team player: one player wins matches, the team wins trophies
- You have a problem solver mindset: we face new challenges every day
- You are comfortable communicating in English: we are people from diverse nationalities, so it’s our company's official language

Bonus points

- Experience with a programming language
- Previous experience working in an e-commerce
- You keep up-to-date with the QA industry’s best practices, tools and techniques
- You are contributing to conferences, meetups, articles…

Our current tech stack :

- Microservice architecture in the cloud with AWS, Kubernetes (check out our blog)
- JavaScript (NextJS, React Native), Java, Kotlin, GolangJira and Xray for test scenario management
- CodeceptJS, Detox, Webdriver for GUI testing
- Postman, Newman and CodeceptJS, Behat, PACT for API testing
- Gitlab / Bitrise / Bitbar for our CI/CD/CT together with Sonarqube for Code quality
- And more... including an in-house defect management system!

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European
    leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY
    & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
    the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are
    850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices
    (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
    boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and
    (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a
    look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

The team:

The Pulse team develops and maintains solutions
    that provide insights from key data. We focus on providing efficient tools, such as infrastructure monitoring,
    logging, costs explorer, incidents management tools. When developing these solutions, we think about the problem
    from end to end.

The opportunity:

As a Senior Technical Writer, you will play a crucial role in helping to
    develop new documentation, while improving existing content and ensuring effective user assistance across our
    products. We are looking for a Software Engineer who has a keen sense of semantics...

You will:

- Maintain and
    improve the documentation processes
- Contribute to the development of our technical communication strategy
-
    Gather and incorporate user feedback on documentation and technical communication
- Create lightly technical
    content, such as tutorials or short introductory blog posts on Medium
- Edit and drive to publication highly
    technical content written by software engineers
- Independently gather information from subject matter experts to
    translate technical information into simple, polished, and engaging content.
- Help with delivery of existing
    Pulse-maintained products (Helm, Gitlab CI)
- Contribute to, or propose and develop, internal tooling in either
    Python or Go
- Work with Engineering teams to specify feature sets aimed at improving and facilitating measurement,
    monitoring
- Identify potential problems to and creating scalable solutions to ensure continuous improvements to
    quality of service
- Trending, the ability to see how your systems are being used and changing over time is also
    useful
- Show experience with algorithmic design and coding (e.g. Python, PHP, Go, Elixir, Erlang, etc.)
- Write a
    significant amount of code for new and existing services

We're looking for someone with excellent written,
    verbal, and interpersonal skills, and someone who is analytical with strong attention to detail, who works
    efficiently in a lively environment, and can quickly prioritize deadlines. Ideally, you're a native English or
    French speaker, who is fluent in both languages and has experience writing technical documentation in
    English.

This person must also master one or more of the following languages in order to actively participate in
    the development of the products on which the PULSE team innovates : 

- golang, python, clojure, nodejs

We have
    many products that need to go to the next level such as incident management, cloud budget management, cloud cost
    monitoring, compliance management or failures injection.

You have previous experience writing documentation and
    materials for technical and non-technical audiences. You have an excellent capacity for written and oral expression
    in English and are proficient in English Technical Writing. You know how to adapt in a changing environment, handle
    multiple projects simultaneously, with an eye for prioritization and you are able to interact and coordinate with
    people of various technical backgrounds. If you want to work on innovative products with an incredible team, join
    us!

The team is diverse and distributed, and collaborates daily over Zoom, and Slack. We’re looking for someone
    who is an excellent communicator, who enjoys and makes the most of these different mediums, while still having the
    organizational skills and discipline to excel within a wholly distributed & full remote team.

Requirements: 
-
    forensic abilities and methodology

Bonus points:
- React, JS, CDN, caching, web vitals, Grafana, Datadog, SEO,
    AWS
- Know what is opentracing, statsd, dogstatsd, open telemetry
- Have experience working with and analyzing
    complex systems in UNIX/Linux distributed production environments.

descriptionPlain:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European
    leader specialised in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY
    & gardening online products. With more than 3600 seller partners and 10 million products, ManoMano brings together
    the largest offer across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom. 

We currently are
    850 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 4 offices
    (Paris x2, Bordeaux and Barcelona). People are at the heart of ManoMano’s culture around our 3 core values :
    boldness, ingenuity and care.

Joining us is a tremendous human and business adventure ! We offer an ideal and
    (hyper)dynamic environment to put your skills on innovative and concrete projects on a European scale.
 
Take a
    look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

The Payment feature team is responsible for providing payment
    methods to ManoMano’s customers. ManoMano manage payment of billion euro annual transaction requiring security
    (PCI-DSS), fraud detection and money flow control. All connected to multiple PSPs to provide the payment method
    corresponding to the needs of our customers in all markets.Your challenge as a Staff Backend Engineer will be to
    help the team to create microservices, ensuring the scalability, robustness (fault tolerance), consistency and
    performance required by using concepts such as idempotency, circuit breaker, services distributed, reactive
    architecture, back pressure and more to guarantee a quality payment service for years to come.

CONTEXT

- 25
    feature teams in January 2021 and expect to grow x2 in next year
- Agile mindset is there since the birth of
    ManoMano
- Main default method is Scrum within 2 weeks iteration
- 3 offices: Paris, Bordeaux and Barcelona
-
    Language for writing is English; speaking is english by default or french, spanish, german...

MAIN
    ACTIVITIES

You will join a team, composed of 4 Developers + 1 Lead + 1 Product Manager, in order to create, in
    collaboration with the product and UX / UI teams, an amazing experience for the merchants and the customers. 

As
    a Staff Software Engineer in this team, you will have to :

- Design and develop features with a high quality
    standard
- Assimilate business context and company expectations to be creative and relevant
- Learn & teach
    through code reviews
- Improve the quality and testing of technical components
- Deploy your code up to production
    and be involved in monitoring it
- Coach and help developers to grow and improve, be a skilled leader to
    them

TECHNICAL STACK :

* Microservices
- Java >= 11 soon 17 with SpringBoot 2 / Kotlin
- MySQL, Postgre
-
    RabbitMQ, Kafka
- Redis
- Gitlab & CI/CD
- Docker
- AWS EKS / Kubernetes
- Jira / Slack

REQUIREMENTS

- +7
    years of experience as a Backend Developer
- High understanding of Micro-service Architecture: DDD, SOLID,
    Distributed Systems architecture.
- Unit Testing, Acceptance Testing, Integration Testing, Load, Testing, Contract
    Testing
- Creative / Innovative
- Knowledge in Monitoring, Alerting
- Ability to design new systems and
    features
- Team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills, as well as a good sense of humor!
- Software
    Craftsmanship
- Previous experiences in Payment would be great
- Fluent in english

INTERVIEW PROCESS :

1/
    Phone interview with a Talent Recruiter 
+ Technical Test (CodinGame)
2/ Zoom interview with a Team Lead +
    Software Engineer
3/ Final Zoom interview with an Engineering Manager or VP Engineer
